If I remove the Amazon echos from the theater group The correct Echo will respond. I contacted technical support and they are completely clueless. I then decided to test out my whole house group that I use quite often to play my music in every room. Most of the time my speakers don't respond at all and they don't play music. if they do respond , only 1 Amazon Echo plays the music even though these Amazon echos are in the same group that I asked to play. When I tried to tell them to stop , they acknowledge me speaking to them but do not stop playing the music. It became extremely frustrating to the point where I was yelling at my echo With no response. Amazon really needs to go back to the drawing board on this 3rd generation and fix their bugs.

The sound is good, I sometimes wonder if I should have gotten the speaker with the sub, but good sound for what I did order. I spent three days trying to get Alexa to play "Deadmen" By Saint PHNX, a song I purchased. Even if I had not bought it she would not have played it. Kept wanting to play "Deadman Walking" by IDK and IDC. So if I had prime she would have queued that up every time. Finally, while almost placing my mouth on her, Alexa figured it out on the third day. But also it is in my only playlist, that I play, then it stops after like 10 songs. I do think Amazon is trying to gaslight me into buying prime for better use of my Echo.She does do well answering questions, turning on devices, playing what music I can get out of her though.

I have a Dot in nearly every room, many of them grouped for stereo and an Echo Sub. As this new Echo (3rd gen) was released, I got excited by learning the previous version, the Echo Plus, was compatible to group for stereo. So I purchased this and another Echo Sub and set it up in what we call our yoga room. It’s been great and I find myself just sitting in the room to listen to music. All that said, the Alexa service isn’t perfect yet. She has moments of inoperability and it’s super annoying when Alexa doesn’t hear you correctly or just stops playing altogether. But that is a different issue than the hardware. This speaker is great and I recommend it. (Note: This speaker does not have the hub feature, so get the Echo Plus if that’s what you require.)

column2: Easy to install and use, LOUD, and conveniently flexible
column5: I got my first Echo as a gift from my brother, and I was extremely impressed with it. As a legally blind person, I can't use my laptop anymore, so the first Echo was a godsend. It helps me to find information, listen to podcasts, music and books, and play games and educate my s of in different ways, and easily order items I might need.The first device died after 5 years of use, and after some collaborations, I was able to gather enough gift cards for a replacement. I picked up the Echo 3rd gen, and I'm very happy. It's loud enough to drown out the neighbor's loud music and my roommates' Fox News; it's clear enough that I can hear my podcasts without straining, and it's just as easy to use as the original.Definitely worth the price. 10/10.

A little buggy. Has trouble switching between different devices streaming to it. Had to delete and reinstall the app to get it to work with my TV.  I have both the Echo and the Dot and the multi-room music works well. Only complaint right now is that there is no integration with YouTube Music. I can't have Alexa play music from YouTube Music without streaming directly from my phone,  which defeats the purpose.  Amazon's unlimited music service is less than half the cost of YouTube Premium, so that's a good reason to switch I guess- but then I lose the ability to watch ad-free videos on YouTube.  Maybe I just talked myself into it.  I don't really watch YouTube videos. I'll probably check out the library on Amazon Unlimited Music and see if it compares.

I have been enjoying Alexa devices for a few.mo the now. My first was a Echo Gen 2 and I love it. Then I was able to get a great deal on the Twilight edition Echo Gen 3 and am so glad I did despite the delay in deliver of the item. My kids also enjoy Alexa. The Echo had wonderful sound and we enjoy finding new skills that are useful and fun. Yes not all skills work well but you can always disable skills that don't work well for you or end up not being what you expected. Alexa is always learning new things and it is fun to figure out what new features and skills are coming up to add onto what you already enjoy about Alexa. My daughter and I also really enjoy using the drop in feature so we can call each other from different floors in the house.
None

I am not a tech type person at all.  I like music and happen to think of songs often and wonder who the artist is or want to hear the song, for this reason I give this little device rave reviews.  I am not all concerned with invasion of privacy much as all things have invaded and negatively impacted our privacy and health- nothing is as it seems, may as well enjoy some perks while getting the shaft.  The sound is great in a space of 500 sq ft., is responsive to my voice but I don't make request like I am talking to a human, there's no kids yelling to it, my house is quiet which may impact how Alexa software responds.  It's a new concept/device and as with most new things, it's not perfect.  And with all man-made things, it never will be.

column2: Paired with my Echo Plus 2. So happy with sound.
column5: Upgraded my Echo 2nd generation for this 3rd generation so I could stereo pair this with a 2nd generation Echo Plus. The difference in just having a two Echos in a group and them being in a STEREO pair is amazing! The separation of left and right channels produces beautiful sound for the money!

Although I’m still skeptical about whether or not Google, or any other media is listening to me even as I speak this review, the unit appears to work very well, tries to be funny, and integrated well with other products. If she chuckles after I complete this review I’ll know she’s listening.

column2: Very happy with it. Good sound quality.
column5: I've had an echo dot (2nd gen) for awhile, so I was already accustom to interfacing with Alexa.  I used the dot primarily as a music player, and had it plugged in to a boombox-type of unit to improve the sound quality.  After reading about the Echo smart speaker's sound quality, I decided to give it a try.  I was immediately very pleased with the sound quality, and after doing a side-by-side comparison with the echo-dot-and-boombox arrangement, the new Echo smart speaker quickly replaced my former setup.  It has surprisingly good bass performance, considering its size, and reminds me of the sound quality of what I would call a "table radio" (for those old enough to remember such things).  All in all, I am very happy with this item.

I spoke with someone via chat about the 4 echo's I purchased and they are rude, not helpful and very impolite!!!!!Ashish | Customer ServiceMaragadham | Customer ServiceWhat happened Amazon??? you always have nice polite and very helpful agents, but today I had the worst experience.I am shocked!!!!!

column2: Didn't know how much I needed this!!!!!
column5: I'm truly loving my Amazon Echo, the sound from this speaker is fantastic for playing music, audio books.  I like that it connects to more products than any of the other similar devices out there and even connects to my Apple music and playlists.  I use it to operate my Hue Lights, play my Audible audio books, music, make phone calls, send messages, create grocery lists.  There more that can be done, I'm new to the Echo so each day I'm learning. One of the things I like also is that you can, with the touch of a button, mute the device if you don't want it "listening" for some reason.  I now want Amazon Echo's in every room, you can even use them like intercoms also.  You'll be happy with your purchase, I promise!

This product is fantastic. For about 6 years I owned a popular mini speaker that rhymes with “pose”, “shows” and “blows” (I think you can figure it out) that cost more than double what the echo costs. As much as I hated the fact that I owned one of these “brand name” speaker, it actually sounded impressive for its small size, so impressive that I had it for 6 years. When I was contemplating buying some smart speaker, I was tempted with the Sonos for its sound quality and reputation but the price tag always seemed high. I bought the echo on a whim, as it were, and I’m thoroughly impressed. Not only does it put my old speaker to shame in terms of sound, ease of use and looks, the multi-room music and home-theater configuration options are second to none. After 2 days of owning this speaker, I bought another and bought an echo plus for another room in my house. Don’t get me wrong, it’s still a smaller size speaker and doesn’t have the power of some bigger speaker out there, where you will be blown away is the value of the speaker. I haven’t seen a speaker this small and at this dollar amount perform as well as this speaker. 10/10 would recommended.

This is my first device with artificial intelligence.  So far, I have only played music, made a phone call, and asked for the weather, sports score, etc.  It is amazing what it can do.  I made a mistake during set up and gave it the wrong mobile phone number.  I called customer service and they answered with a live person almost immediately.  She walked me through the numerous steps to correct the problem and it worked.  I couldn't be happier with the device and the customer service.

column2: Unbelievable for the price, Sounds Fantastic - so good I almost cried !
column5: Been years since I bought a product this good, answers questions and plays music when I ask it to. Only negative is it doesnt support Apple Airplay as far as I can tell. Havent found a way to play my itunes downloaded music but I've only had it for a few days. Streams apple music and amazon music perfectly, spotify, etc. Sound is Fantastic !! Nice bass - I dont play it like my college days but for my daily use, I LOVE THIS>

I ordered  this Alexa because  I thought I blew it anapeaker in my old alexa. For some reason the volume is down on alexa. I ordered this one and the volume is not loud at all. I called amazon and they say they have no bad reviews  on the volume. When I got my original  alexa you could hear it upstairs. This alexa you can not hear at all upstairs.
None

column2: first time using this in my house
column5: install went easy. after about a week, I notice that it would no wake up when I speak to it, had to reboot. but this was hit and miss. I also notice sometimes there will be static in the background when speaking, again this is hit and miss.other wise its ok.

Bought this to replace a public beta-era Generation 1 unit. The first gen unit had slowed down a bit, and was beginning to struggle with running our smart home components, missing light bulbs and other things in the Hue network.This thing is FAST compared to earlier models. What would take 5-10 seconds of processing for the gen-1 takes only a second or two for this model. The sound quality remains excellent for music playback, and while the model is "fatter" it is noticeably shorter, making it slightly more subtle for where I have mine (on a table next to a wall).If you're looking to get your first Echo or upgrade from an older model I definitely recommend making the change.

column2: Gen 1 is still better. Better luck next time.
column5: The sound is a bit muffled, but the bass and volume are good. Fairly close to the Gen 1 echo (unlike Gen 2, which is horrible). I did a side by side comparison like I did with the Gen 2. Gen 1 had a clear victory in clarity and a slim victory with bass and volume. On a separate note, I'm having some trouble with the Gen 3 staying engaged when I request something. The blue light turns off before I can finish the second word after Alexa.

I have had an Echo since it came out, I do have a V1 and needed another for another room.  I replace the V1 with a better looking V3 Echo and it looks great in the living room.  But, maybe it is just a sentiment me, the V1 seems to respond better and the audio is clearer then the V3.  I have to talk louder to the V3...and even then sometime I have to repeat.  I am still using the V1 unit and often stream on both.  I still have a 5 star rating on the V1, but feel the V3 is a bit of a disappointment.  I will give it more time...

This has a slightly more full bodied sound than the Second Generation echo that is very clear with a warm tone. For me, the difference isn't great enough to make it the single most important reason for the upgrade, but the line in jack was what sold me.  I wanted something for the devices I have that do not have Bluetooth and the slightly bigger sound is just a nice bonus. As usual it is easy to set up and performs as expected.Even though I can't make a stereo pairing with my Second Gen Echo, having them at opposite ends of the room and creating a group for them mmore than fills the room with very nice sounding audio so am quite pleased with my purchase.

The Echo is small but it has a powerful sound. The ease of use is not there at this time. I have to ask Alexa to do things several times before she gets it correct, especially when it comes to the firestick, and it should not be that hard because they are both created in Amazon labs. I will give them a pass because this is a new technology. I love the fact that I have a GROUP called Everywhere and I can stream music on this Echo and all three dots at the same time and it is clean and consistent through the entire house. This is very nice on days when I am cleaning the house and go from room to room, and during the holidays when I had everyone over. Overall I am satisfied, and I look for even more things from Amazon. I also have a Ring doorbell, I am on my way!

Dissapointed that this device keeps freezing and becoming unresponsive most often when playing music. Amazon tech support recommendations were to reset the device which doesn't work. It fixes the problem in the moment but doesn't fix whatever the underlying issue is. I have not had this problem with any of my other amazon devices. If regularly unplugging and restarting your device isn't a problem for you then it's a great product. It's materials are good quality, sounds fantastic, looks great but I can not overlook its faults... especially if I can't trust it to play music while putting my toddler down for a nap.

column2: Fairly Decent Upgrade From Gen 1 - But not quite their.
column5: We originally purchased a first generation Alexa when they came out. It is a great device that we still use in another part of the house now that we have this newer generation version. Aside from it being a little shorter and more stout, it's otherwise no different whatsoever from the first generation. The one exception to that is the sound. The bass is just slightly better on the new device, but not a lot to make an impact. Sound is still dull, with no defining highs or lows, just more a blaring mid range sound. If they can fix this or offer a device with much better audio, we'd get that. Is it with the money to upgrade from a Gen1? I'd say no, not yet.

column2: Alexa is fantastic, sound less so.
column5: Bought one of these for the kitchen. It replaces a Memorex Party Cube which had thoroughly degraded over a decade.The functionality of Alexa is discussed at length everywhere and is amazing. My only issue with this device is the sound quality. I think it's inherent to the design and I did anticipate this. First of all, the bass is astounding. I didn't know something this size could create that kind of bass. I'm afraid treble is another story. In order to create the 360 degree sound, the tweeter (as you can see in the product description) is pointed upward inside the device. It fires internally. The midrange radiates quite well out of the unit as reflected sound. However, the high frequencies (say, above 14khz) do not fare so well. So overall the treble slopes off quite a bit. The old Party Cube, like the Sonos One, has outward firing tweeters, so you are not relying on sound reflection for what you hear - you get the whole spectrum straight from the source, like conventional speakers. So you miss a bit of the magic of vocals, or drum high hats, atmospheric sounds and the like. Out of the box the overall tone is weighed quite a bit to mid bass. Alexa has some basic tone control (Bass, Midrange, Treble) which can help just a bit.Overall though, the Pros outweigh the cons on this device and I'm happy to have it!

column2: Like it except for the disconnects
column5: I like it, it sounds surprisingly good for such a small speaker.  Unfortunately it randomly shuts off.  To restart, it needs to be unplugged and then plugged in. This happens every 2 hours or so.  I wanted to exchange to hopefully get a unit that stayed connected but tech support had other ideas.  They wanted me to change the name and password of my WIFI network.  I explained that my WIFI stays connected without interruption to a TV, printer, 2 iPhones and 2 computers.  There is no chance that I will make changes to a properly functioning WIFI network, requiring me to update the network name and password on all my devices.  If tech support was accurate then the product design needs to be improved, a device should not require altering a perfectly functioning WIFI network.
None

column2: Black Friday = More Echo's for me!
column5: I love my Echo's.  This is a perfect addition to my Echo Plus and other various dots.  I have them connected around the house mainly for music.  The Echo has much better sound than the Dot so they go in the rooms most open to guests.  The dots are used to fill in the back rooms where the lower quality won't be noticed as much.  So much other functions to offer but for now this is their main function.  Thank you Amazon!

Much better sound.  It's smaller by a bit too.  Easy set up.  Love it.  I bought 2 but might get a third. The sound improvement warrants that.  Also, the ability to sync all 3 to play the same tunes simultaneously.

column2: Well worth the money on this new version
column5: My daughter and her family asked for this newest generation Echo for Christmas. After we bought hers, we decided to get a new one for ourselves. Since we already have an Echo, I really thought about saving some money and returning ours. I’m so glad we didn’t! We just plugged it in yesterday and wow! The sound is just so much better! It’s beautiful! Also have to say that I love the blue color as well. For some reason, we didn’t even have to go into the Alexa app to connect this. We just plugged it in and she took over for the old Alexa.  Great purchase! If you listen to music you will notice a vast difference.

This was my 1st time purchase of an Amazon Echo device. So far I like everything about it. It is so amazing that it will play any genre , or even artist that I ask for. t gives me the weather so fast. I like the options of turning off  some of the features that I am leery about, such as ordering items thru Alexa. Maybe sometime I may be more comfortable doing this, but for now it's turned off. It is really nice hearing another person's voice.  I like this device so well that I ordered 2 echo dots. One for my bedroom and one for the kitchen, as well as 2 Amazon smart plugs for Alexa to turn on and off lights.

column2: Everyone needs this in their life.
column5: The sound quality is amazing. Went with a bigger one to use for speaker mainly. Between me and my girls we now own 6 or 7 of these echo’s. The only one I don’t recommend is the echo input. It does not stay connected. In its defense I was too lazy to trouble shoot and just ordered a new echo instead. If you don’t have one. Get it. I will say it entertains the toddlers, but careful because Alexa hears what she wants to hear and sometimes plays inappropriate music. You can change that in settings if I’m. Or mistaken. I have mine connected through WiFi and I think it requires it. Might want to check on that.
The 3rd generation Echo speaker is sooo much better than the prior versions.  A real pleasure to listen to,

I can't believe the sound that comes out of this small enclosure. I was blown away by the deep bass....no, I was actually shocked. I am very impressed and glad that I traded my gen 1 echo for this one, it is 100 times better.

I ordered the new third generation Echo on Black Friday. What upset me right off the bat is that it was shipped to me in a flimsy Tyvek envelope. No extra packing for protection. As for the unit itself, it  is very similar to the second generation Echo. The sound is a little bolder with more base response. The only issue, so far, is with the end of request response sound when it is switched on in settings. For no apparent reason, it occasionally blares at full volume at the end of request response. The only remedy is to turn off the end of request sound in settings. No such issue with my first and second generation Echoes.

column2: Nice, but we miss the battery on board that our Tap has.
column5: As original Tap owners we were waiting for a major improvement before adding to our Alexia family.  Trade in was only $15 for the tab and we love that the tap has always been about privace, unless you turn it off in the app and that the Tap has a battery to take it outside on the deck.Our new Alexia has no battery and has the mute button to provide privacy.  It also makes calls which the Tap does not.Overall pleased with the new device, but keeping the Tap to take outside as wed need to bring an extension cord to the woods if we wanted to take the new device.

edit- There’s no point in writing a negative review on an Amazon product because they won’t post it.  Just post the good ones.  I have my speakers paired and run them in stereo.  The set up was easy.  To me, the sound quality is OK ( I’m no sound expert).  But sometimes one speaker will stop playing in the middle of a song and start a new song while the other speaker continues playing the original song.  This happens often.  Then I have to tell Alexa to stop, then start again.  This is annoying. I’m hoping because the 3rd generation is new,  this is a bug that will soon be fixed.
None

column2: Do not buy for Home theater sound!! Not worth it!
column5: So I ordered two of these echos and 1 sub for 2.1 home theater surround sound. Big fan of amazon products. Very disappointed with the home theater set up and if your buying for that purpose, it’s not worth it. I’m running on 5ghz. There is always an issue. One side it working and the other isn’t. Then it swaps, then they both work but the sub is not working. If you watch tv in the early mornings like 5-6am, forget about it. No sound because the devices are unreachable for some reason. Then you have to unpair and pair them again(some devices would still show unreachable. Then you gotta unplug device and plug again). There are set up in my living room where my WiFi is. My point is that it’s not seamless connect, since I got it I’ve always been playing around with it to make it stay connected. Gotten to the point where I disconnected it and just hearing sound through my TV. Thinking about returning an echo and sub as I don’t need two echos and I’m not going to have a sub laying around for no reason. Oh and to connect musics, forget about it. The app is horrible for music. I can’t even choose a song from my Apple Music to play. I had to create a playlist for amazon on my Apple app and in the amazon app I can’t even choose the song I want to play or even shuffle the music! This is a complete fail and amazon let me down on this one. The sound on the echo itself is decent.

column2: Great Sound, Fun Interface, Good price.
column5: Works great. Easy to set up and fun to play with. Has a bit of problem recognizing voices (my sister and mom both get called my name), but overall can understand what we ask. It seems to forget some things that it knew at first. When I asked it to play a playlist from my Amazon music, it did it correctly the first few times and then stopped being able to figure out what I wanted.My one major complaint is that I can’t play music through Echo’s speakers if I have asked it to link to my Alexa enabled Bose speaker. I’d like to hear the music in both rooms but only one works at a time. Not the end of the world and I purchased the unit on sale for $79 so well worth the price.

The sound quality is a huge improvement over the last gen echo. It’s basically the same as the second gen echo plus. It doesn’t work as a stereo pair though.However Alexa is pretty awful. It struggles to understand my commands and rarely ever plays the correct song on the first try. There are problems integrating with Apple Music. I feel like it’s somehow gotten worse.I already have a few of them but if I had the choice, I probably wouldn’t buy into this system again.

I just recently bought this device, I've had another one for a few years but I thought something was wrong with it, as looped sounds kept cutting off. Well I am having the same issue with this one. I use it for playing sleep sounds and now it cuts off every few minutes or cuts off all together, the exact same thing that had begun happening with my old device. I did some research and have since found out lots of people have been reporting this problem. It's bad enough Amazon farms their skills out to third party developers who are now trying to get people to pay for them, so you get long annoying ads as well as constant prompts for a 5 star review on your device..... (I've also seen where even if you get a subscription half the time it doesn't work and Amazon does nothing about it) but the looping problem is directly related to Amazon's product as it happens on the old and new devices and also happens when trying to loop music...think next time I will give Google assistant a try, maybe they make their own skills for their own device.

This is my fourth Echo unit and I am impressed with the quality of sound from this unit. I own one of the first generation Echo and they have truly come a long way.  I like the fact that when I ordered it AMAZON asked if I wanted associated to my account, this made the setup process much easier. Since I started hanging out in my garage again, this Echo keeps me well informed and entertained, if I’m not listening to my news radio station, I’m listening to my favorite crime podcast or listening to smooth jazz. This is a truly great piece of gear and a great ROI.

We started out with an echo dot that we got free with our cable tv service. We loved it but it was so small we couldn’t hear it WEP so we decided to upgrade. This did not disappoint! The volume is amazing and Alexas voice is clear. Also, can hear me from across the house asking her questions etc. which is a definite bonus. Better than my iPhone and Siri who half the time doesn’t hear me and/or doesn’t answer my questions but instead tells me to open a webpage she found. Alexa has yet to tell me she doesn’t know the answer to something! Definitely worth the money.

column2: Big improvement of the first generation.
column5: We absolutely love the newest generation. Sound is much improved over the first generation it replaces. Alexa seems to listen better too. The new design look great and love the new color option.

Bought 2 and  subwoofer they sound like they  shorted out .  They would  play maybe one song with all three playing next song they would go out one then the other. Has Amazon tech help twice. They did it play continuously .They werepacked with a small amount of  of plastic that was blowed up like small plastic bags. I think they should have used styrofoam to protect the speakers  , they were probably throughed around doing shipping and caused something to come a loose. The only thing I noticed is they would no play continuously. Very disappointed.

I got this for my wife as she enjoys listening to music with our kids. She's been using her phone and our TV up to this point for her music needs and the sound quality is just not there. This speaker allows her to be able to use Bluetooth, Aux. port, or Amazon Music. I purchased this speaker instead of a normal Bluetooth speaker for the "Smart" features of it. I got the Echo instead of the Dot for the Woofer (bass) for music. Our whole family loves talking to Alexa, and we can also use the smart feature of Alexa for other things than just music. I would say, so far, we are extremely happy with this purchase.

Works fine.  Sounds good.  The improvements that need to be made all lie within the Alexa app. The faults that I found,so far, are the  inability to loop a song (and especially a playlist) indefinitely. My sleep list, or even a looped song play out before I'm ready to get up.  Also, no battery compatibility- at least not in the USA.I'm not sure yet about his one, but I'm wondering if can I use the speaker AND broadcast it to a Bluetooth receiver/device at the same time?  I mean hear both the Echo and the other device(s) at the same time.
None
Love the sound and clarity. Upgraded from an Echo Dot and so glad I did. We mostly listen to the echo for music and this new echo sounds incredible!

My wife has been wanting Alexa for years. I bought it for her the other day. She is tickled. She can listen to her music. The sound is remarkably good. She sets her timers for cooking. She sets reminders. It's capable of doing more than we'll ever need. It's a great addition to our home.

I love the way the alexa 3 gen sounds but it is still lacking in a lot of ways.. especially when it comes to setting up light bulbs.  I bought 2 different kind including the one that was part of the package put together by amazon and I couldn't get them to hook up at all. My neighbor next door had the same problem but he broke down and bought a hub so the worked thru that not the alexa itself.  I had no trouble with the outlets.  Problem with that is if the wifi goes out you have to climb behind your furniture to unplug your outlets to be able to use what ever you had plugged into them..Remember if you have wifi that goes out you don't want everything to be a smart device thru the alexa.  Alexa does not work for anything if the wifi goes out.As I said earlier the sound quality of music is really great. Volume is really good as well. It goes about as loud as a person could want.I also attempted using amazons templates for making a skill. They need to work on their templates a a couple of them were not working properly to be able to share what you taught it to make.. Shame I had really high hopes for this device.

column2: It's like the computer in Star Trek!
column5: I have no need, never gonna. Then I did. Wow, this is such an amazing device. How could I live without it now? I use mine in the kitchen. Plays my music and podcasts, runs multiple timers, converts recipe measurements, gives weather reports, integrated with my home security system, and much more. I love using it for calls that are truly hands free. I actually got a second one for my room, great as an arm clock, plays thunderstorms for going to sleep and my audio books! Sound quality is good, setup was super easy.

Bought 2 Echo’s and 2 Dot’s and linked for whole house music system. Great for background and up to relatively loud medium volume. Easy set up to link and custom configurations. Great for parties and especially for the holidays with pleasant background music.  Good sound up to about 80% volume, but gets a little “hysterical” at full volume. Probably will upgrade to the “big one” once available at less than the current $199.  Great whole house system for $160.

We had two of the older models in our house already.  My wife and I tossed around the idea of adding a 3rd to play music from end to end.  Yes, we have a smaller 3 bedroom home and on cyber Monday, we decided to go for the third.  I was impressed by the better quality sound of the 3rd generation Echo.  It has more of a base sound resulting in a fuller spectrum.  I love the idea of asking Alexa to play a song on our group across the house.  We have had no problems syncing or playing on all 3 devices as a group.

column2: Sleek, great sound and easy to use
column5: After what seemed like years of deliberating over purchasing an Alexa we decided to take the dive on Black Friday. The Echo and Dots we have throughout the house work far beyond our expectations. As music lovers, and parents with full hands-our favorite feature is being able to control and connect music throughout our home with just our voices. The sound quality and bass is much better than our expensive speakers, they’re sleek and incredibly easy to set up. Overall we are very impressed and happy with our purchase!
Received a broken device! Would not connect to wifi..Tech support said it was my router which is a load of crap.. after an hr on the phone they agreed to send me a new one..

column2: First generation is definitely more Superior than this 3rd generation
column5: this version is not comfortable to the first generation. First of all the  bass sound is adjusted to take over and often times it causes discomfort to listen to even when the bass is adjusted to the lowest available level . The voice recognition is also less Superior than the first generation. It often has Hang Ups and a red circle indicating its inability to respond to a question or at a speed at which comprable to the first generation Alexa. We had the worst time connecting it to our Wi-Fi this time. Overall we are not pleased with the change in the base which causes literally the floor to vibrate even said at the lowest level. This takes away from the actual music that's being played and we have to adjust the volume down just so we can have less Bass which compromises the listening experience. I find this Alexa to not be an improvement to the first-generation and I wish I could buy another first-generation which broke recently.  I I am very disappointed in this new generation  which I was looking forward to and thought would be even a greater version from the first generation. If it weren't for the fact that Alexa Can Read Wikipedia entries I would have purchased my personal assistant from another company.

column2: I upgraded from my 1st Gen Echo Dot to a 3rd Gen Echo and LOVE IT!
column5: Few years back I received my first amazon device, the Echo Dot! It has been a great device but it was time to upgrade and I needed to have a louder sounding speaker (which the 1st Gen Echo Dot didn't really have). I use my Echo device in the bathroom because when the hair dryer is going or the shower is going, I wanted to hear my music still. I am very happy with this device! I feel like on this device, Alexa responds better as well. Easy setup too! The speaker has great bass as well. I recommend it!
None

My friends have the 1st and 2nd Gen, when they come to my house up north all I was using was a mp3 player with a Bluetooth speaker. They kept telling me about their Alexa echo and how much they liked it for playing their music. So I ordered one this past black Friday sale. Every week I would have to down load different songs and then load them to the mp3 player now I just have to ask Alexa. It's only been a few days but I am Loving it. Now when they come up to visit they will be able to play their favorite songs as well.

This new Echo has very good quality sound. It took the place of an Echo Dot (smaller unit) that was in our living room. The Dot worked great however we moved it to the bedroom and replaced it with the Echo and as a result it provides great sound, clearer audio and it looks great as well. We found that we can use a lower sound setting and achieve clear sound and great volume. We like both units and now they are in locations that suit them best.  We use them for our 6 wi-fi outlets as well and they work great through the Alexa app or voice command. I highly recommend either one of these units. Just consider up front the size area and type of sound quality you are looking for. Thanks!

Only been using Echo 3rd Generation a few days now but, it's proving to be another entertainment source & a handy helper. Besides the usual tame uses like playing songs and asking it to tell jokes, it provides a lot of pertinent day to day information like weather and even looking up plane & train schedules.  Also, I have one near my hobby workbench. When working on various projects, it's useful to ask math problems and even used it to compute a few Ohm's Law problems. So, it's a useful item to have for both entertainment and work.

Alexa was easy to install and the instructions online were very helpful.  I have been using it for music, time,  night sounds, and answering questions.  She can also provide trivia, jokes and weather as well as many other things like giving a recipe step by step.  The echo plays music upon request and can be used to phone people although they did seem to have a little trouble hearing me if I was not close to the echo.  If I needed to get in touch with someone if sick or hurt I could have Alexa make a call for me from another room in my house.

As two 70+ people, we have watched our daughter use her echo and decided to get one for ourselves. We aren’t using any of the smart features but are completely enjoying the access to music and creating lists. We’ve only had it a short while and I’m sure we’ll expand our use with it as we get more familiar. I’m loving the the light blue color! So much nicer in my LR that the black!

I had an older model and decided to upgrade to this one. The sound quality is much better. Easy to use. It does seem to cut out more than my other alexa though. I will have to unplug it and sometimes she just stops in the middle of playing. Not sure if its my wifi, but it didnt happen with my other one.

I had a Bose surround sound set up in the family room but was tired of the wires. I had bought a sound bar but wasn’t impressed with the sound when I played my music and watching tv/movies. So I bought 2 of these and paired them as “front speakers” with the new update (I have the Fire Tv Cube). My only gripe is that the volume only goes to 10 which is fine for Amazon Music but when certainty shows or movies with action scenes come into play, it doesn’t sound as loud as I would like it. I plan on purchasing the Echo sub soon and maybe the 2 new Echo Studios when the funds are available. A little pricey at $199 each which output Dolby Atmos. Maybe by then more movies and tv shows will output in that format.

Not as good understanding of the wale word as the 1st gen. My dot is quicker picking up the WW even it is in the far end of the living room. Had to unplug the dot just so that I get to use this device more often. It also often dies on itself when alarm goes off. Had to unplug to restart. Sound is superior of course.

column2: Great product, replaces Echo dot and speaker
column5: This was an Xmas gift, we have two echo dots, first generation, and this replace the dot and Anker Soundcore Bluetooth speaker we used in the kitchen. Sound quality is good enough to be able to hear music in the dining room from the kitchen, and voice recognition is good enough for to pick up from 15’ away.  Have to much closer for voice recognition with the dots. Will use the dots in other areas of house to control smart Wifi plugs. Great product, easy setup with the Alexa app.

I have been using Echo devices for a couple of years now, i have 18 of them in 2 locations, each time they upgrade I upgrade, I run almost all of my lighting and a few plugs from my echo's, listen to music, have 2 of them and a sub connected thru my HD Fire tv stick for a upgraded movie sound experience that does really good, and i ask questions which alexa usually answers or gives me the information I am asking for. As in any electronics or computer device they have a few bugs that get worked out, the sound quality is great to me, and gets better every time they upgrade, I'm definitely not disappointed.  For the money, they are well worth it. If you want a better sounding speaker go by an expensive speaker that is meant just for being a speaker. They suite my needs very well.
None

We bought this to replace a 3rd Feb. Echo Dot. The Dot has good sound for its size, but we wanted better. This one is a real improvement for listening to music and podcasts. The Echo Studio would have better sound, but at twice the price of the Echo. We like the looks; much more attractive than the 1st gen. Voice recognition is better than the Dot also; maybe because there are more microphones. The fact that we got a Black Friday discount is icing on the cake. Very satisfied with this purchase.

I've had gen 1 dots, gen 1, 2 and 3 Echo's....and I have to say, the sound of the Echo gen 3 is fabulous.  When I first got my first gen 1 Echo a few years ago, I thought, and still do, this thing has great sound.  In my opinion, the generation 2 Echo never did really produce great sound...adequate, but I still think my generation one Echo has better sound.This 3rd generation Echo though blows the socks off anything pervious.  Wow....try it, you'll like it!

Several of my friends have been encouraging me to bring Alexa into my home for a some time now.  With the great prices being offered on Black Friday I decided to purchase an Echo 3rd Generation device.  It was extremely easy to register with the Alexa app and integrate it with my home WiFi.I also bought 2 Amazon Receptacles to control table lamps in rooms of my home.  There’s a lot of things you can do with Alexa and I’m learning a lot of new tricks these days.
Es excelente

column2: Great sound quality. I'm going all digital in 2020! Love Amazon!
column5: I have had a Tap since they first came out. I always loved it. My new Echo 3rd gen is a whole different level way better!. A friend came by today with a sound meter. My new Echo 3 is extremely well balanced in any room in the house. He recommended for full sound, that I get a new Echo3 for each level of my house. Great sound. Very happy camper! For the sound I get and the reasonable investment I'm all in, 2020 is going to be upgrading my security, Thermostat with Amazon!

I bought a pair of the Echo 3rd Gen in blue (a great color, by the way) along with an Echo Sub as a gift to myself. I once had a nice, full stereo turntable system, but got rid of it after too many moves. I have several Echo Dots, but missed a fuller stereo sound. This system was easy to set up, fits unobtrusively into my family room (yes, even in blue), and sounds amazing for its size and cost. I tested it with "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" and it put a smile on my ears.
Me agradó excelente

column2: Sounds better than previous devices, but definitely NOT blue
column5: If this Echo is blue then I'm a giraffe.It's grey. You can squint really hard and pretend that it has a tinge of blue, but it's G-R-E-Y. Does not look like the pics at all.But it does sound better than previous Echo devices so that's what's most important I guess.

Rather you are listening to your audio book or music the sound is amazing.  Especially the bass.  Size is good and of course it's Alexa so you can do anything.  I have 2 one upstairs in my bedroom and one in kitchen.  I ask to listen to my audio book while getting ready for work and then when I go downstairs to make coffee, I can continue there.  I also used it for announcements (come to dinner) and to play music during the holiday season.  Definitely recommend!!!

First the Bad: I have made a lot of iTune music purchases over the years. I either cannot or Alexa won't access iTunes. I've looked online for a fix but I can't find one. Apparently, Amazon wants me to pay $3.99 to play music I already own.The Good: I like being able to ask Alexa to do a lot of other things such as playing the radio, telling the temp and providing answers to random questions.I'm still exploring what Alexa can do.
None

I purchased this Echo because I wanted to pair it with the one I already had. I looked everywhere to be sure that the 2 would pair before purchasing. I was not able to locate that information anywhere so purchased anyway. Found out upon arrival it would not pair with the one I've had for 2 years. How many "generations" have come out in that amount of time!I paid $159 for my original Echo and $59 for this upgraded one. Actually, I think the sound quality is better on my original!

column2: Got advice a Christmas gift & fam loves it!!
column5: My family loves this gift!!! My two boys (hubby-50 & son-9) think it’s the best thing ever! They have enjoyed asking Alexa stupid and inappropriate questions. My two daughters (18 & 15) have enjoyed asking Alexa to play random songs that interrupt the questions from the boys. 🤣 All in all, this will keep my family entertained for quite some time. Definitely plan on upgrading some of our home features so we can use the thermostat and light functions.

I actually like the gen 1 tower's looks, but this short echo in a light blue cloak is cuter. the clincher was the 3mm line in/out port which offers a myriad of flexibility. the sound is quite good - even too loud at max. I do have one suggestion and that is to offer a real amplified out rather than line out, so I can drive an external pair of non-amplified speakers. this would require speaker hookups, so I don't imagine this suggestion would be taken up.

In the morning I ask Alexa what time it is since my alarm didn’t go off just yet. I ask how the weather is and is going to be. Through Alexa I turn my TV on and off, certain lights in my home on or off. I enjoy this technology very much. I also get my radio stations through Alexa, and the sound through Alexa is great. She also reads me bible verses as well, tells jokes and keeps me updated on the news. Like I said, I love it and I bet you will too.

column2: Not happy [**Update :  It's working now, Thanks Amazon support**]
column5: I got this device because it says it does Line-IN.  Of course I get it and it doesn't do LINE IN even though it says it does.  The APP is bugged.  You would think they would test that before releasing it.**Update to 5 stars -- Amazon called and helped get it working.  Happy now :)  Great service-- Thank you!

I got this as an upgrade for my 2nd generation Echo Dot with a Vaux speaker. The Vaux speaker quite holding it charge and was powering off the Dot so I moved the Dot to the bluetooth connection on my entertainment system and got the new Echo for the living room. This little speaker sounds really good and looks so much better than previous generations. When we got our first Echo it was more of a novelty for playing music but has become much more.

column2: Get a pair and add the subwoofer! <3
column5: I bought two of these little gems, with a sub woofer. I synced  them all together to create my own little home sound system. The deep base of the subwoofer really adds to the already well-balanced sound of the third generation devices. I’m not super excited about the voice recognition. I gave it four stars. I’m hoping that as these devices learn how I talk, and the technology gets better, it will be more smooth to use. Right now, Alexa only gets 2-3 out of five commands right. That’s frustrating! The sound, though... makes this purchase worth it.

column2: I Found The Echo Interface With Prime Music To Be Excellent
column5: Until I purchased my third generation Echo earlier this month, I had no idea what I was missing from my Amazon Prime account. I found Amazon Music to be much more to my liking than Prime Video, which my wife and I have enjoyed for several years. The sound quality of the third generation full height Echo is well worth the approximately $60 I paid against my Amazon account. Well done, Amazon. You have enriched my life with Amazon Prime Music.

column2: Light years better with the sound!
column5: I bought one of the original Echos mostly for fun.  It has been a great product, but The sound for music was no better than OK. This new version is a huge improvement in terms of sound.  True audiophiles need to look elsewhere.  However, the average listener will find the sound highly rewarding especially when this Echo is available on sale.  At $60, I highly recommend it.  At $100, you might want to save up for the Echo Studio costing $200.

Seems I got a lazy one. Sometimes it will give me a very detailed answer from Wiki or Google or some newspaper, but most of the time, it is too lazy to really look into what I'm asking about. I get a lot of "Sorry. I don't know that.", or "I'm not sure". Occasionally, it will say, "I'm working on refining my knowledge base", but I think that's a cop out. I do like the music. Of course, that costs extra, as do most of the really cool things I would want to do. Also, it seems easily confused. I don't know: Maybe this one has baggage from not getting along with the other Alexa's in the warehouse.
None

We are enjoying our Echo. We use it to play music,  as a timer during cooking, play quizzes on it and when we leave our home we say "Alexa we are leaving and it responds with I'll start guarding your home" . It will respond to any breaking glass etc. I think we will enjoy having it. The only negative that I have found is that you need to very precise in your questions. I asked our far the state capital was from my home and it heard the Missouri state capital and gave me a distance of several thousand miles.
Love this speaker have cameras and ring doorbell and everything connected. I’ve switched from google home to Alexa

I own both the 2nd and 3rd generation echos. The sound of the 3rd generation is significantly better. However, I prefer the sharper line of the 2nd over the rounded edges on the 3rd. But, if you are trying to decide which echo to get, this is the one. It worth it for the sound alone.
This Alexa 3rd Generation sounds good has a deeper bass,I also have 1 2nd Generation a big difference in the sound quality

column2: Best Comparison to Google and Siri.
column5: I LOVE my echo! Bass is loud, and overall sounds GREAT.HOWEVER, the woman in tech support was really nasty with me. She was testing me as if I'm some dumb customer who should know how to set up the WiFi properly, when I told her it just kept exiting the set up mode on its own. She was pretty impatient with me when she told me how to reboot the device. I said to her to just forget it, and I found a YouTube video how to fix the issue property.

column2: Great for all.... newbie to pro.
column5: I bought this as a gift for my mom who is NOT tech savvy at all. The setup was easy and she hit it off with Alexa! This has helped her become more aware of the way technology works and she can ask Alexa before calling to ask me while I am at work. 😬 the only minor thing is she would like it to be a little louder when she listens to music. I am planning on getting her some dots to place in other rooms. But overall this item was a great gift for anyone cuz now my 7 year old wants one too!

I bought three  of them and I loved them for a month.  I ahd two and subwoofer as a speaker set .  Now they wont't stero pair and I can't paly my Amazon.  I spent 90 minutes with Amazon yesterday and I that was a waste of time setting and resetting. Then i tried to pair them again and nothing. I told Amazon the issue and hoped they would fix it but this morning nothing was fixed.  Finally took another hour to fix it and now it's wonderful again

3rd generation Echo is a good product.  Set up is very easy compared to my 1st gen Echo.  I do prefer the 1st gen Echo though.  I feel the 1st gen Echo's sound is much better, and I love the changing the volume by spinning the top edge of the 1st gen Echo.  It is much better way to change the volume then asking Alexa to do it or by pressing the 3rd gen Echo's +/- buttons.  But overall I am satisfied with the 3rd gen Echo.

column2: Does not work with sub woofer
column5: The speaker works well. What was not clear to me (could very well be my fault!) is that it doesn't work with the subwoofer (echo) that I bought and you can only pair 2. I thought I could have several and music through out my house but that isn't the case. I have 2 of the echo 3rd gens in Master bedroom and then 2 dots working with sub woofer. They all work well but this was a draw back that I feel Amazon does not go out of it's way to make clear.

We were given an Alexa with a subsidiary Echo Dot for Christmas,  which we placed in the living room and kitchen. We like it so much that we purchased an additonal Echo Dot for the library upstairs. We haven't explored all the functions, but so far we've found it very helpful for music in different locations, as well as being able to add to the shopping list whenever an item occurs, rather than wait til we are able to write it down on a shopping list. An additional feature is that when someone is out grocery shopping, and the one at home suddenly remembers something which they'd forgotten was needed, they can add it to the list, and it appears on the shopper's phone. Very helpful!
None

column2: Sounds amazing and Alexa is crystal clear.
column5: I bought it during black Friday for 59.99 what a bargain. I love everything about it. I've been using my gf Echo 1st gen but I wanted something for myself and I'm glad I bought this. The sound quality is amazing and Alexa is way better than Siri.

column2: Love the ease of using Echo.
column5: Got this as a gift so I don’t know how much of a value it is but I like it a lot. Easy to use and so convenient. Just tell Alexa what you want. I had it on shelf with loud deep base music and it fell off. Worked fine after that accident. Lots of music  but you may want to buy Amazon Music Unlimited if you want some music such as Led Zeppelin which is not included in Prime. They do offer a free 30 day trial.

It has been a great addition. Our kids love to have their own dance party it whatever room they’re in. We got several of them for around the house and they’re a breeze to sync together or play individually...just form a group in your Alexa app. These go on sale all of the time so just wait for them to go on sale and scoop up a few.Added plus...there’s a ton of smart plugs out there and it’s made life a lot easier.

Bought to replace 2nd Gen DOT that was temperamental (small disc-type).This one listens better,  sounds better,  and doesn't delay when connected to the Bose speaker like the old one.  Always sounded like an outdoor concert (echo) when moving from one room to another.This is not the smart hub... so make sure you're getting the right unit for your needs as they look alike.You won't be disappointed.

I have 2nd Gen and I loved them I have to as a matter of fact. When I saw 3rd Gen come out I was too happy. Saw them come on sale for black Friday and had to get 2. I gave the 2nd gen to my mother I put the 3rd gen in my bed room and the sound beautiful fills the room with sound. Worth the price I am a fan of Echo. I also have 3 Echo shows as well. Just to show I'm not just talking. Waiting for the Sub woofer.

I bought this on black Friday due to my Echo V. 1 broke . I do not recall seeing the stats on v.3 but what a surprise when I plugged it in. In addition to working flawlessly, the music quality is much better, especially with my Amazons UHD music subscription. Nice bass for such a small attractive Echo. I'm a lifelong audiophile and can now use my Echo 3 to play music for something other than background noise.

column2: LOVE this! The sound quality and volume is impressive!!
column5: This is my first Echo, before this, I only had Echo dot. The biggest difference is the ability to crank up the volume. The sound quality is great, and LOUD. It's shockingly loud for the small size!There is no downside at all, if you want an Echo for music, this is a GREAT buy in every way! I got it in red, and had to wait a few weeks for it, but I'm glad I did, and would absolutely buy it again.

I bought three of these this Christmas... One for a granddaughter ten .. two for my twin daughters ... they are all having a ball asking this ALEXA all kinds of things.... It's a learning experience... I did mess up and put that one for g daughter app on my phone which when she took it home it didn't recognize her home... hopefully that will be resolved.... Amazon support gave me answers  immediately about that question... great gifts this year...

Music sounds really good and Alexa's voice is loud and clear.  I only wish I had bought one of these sooner.  Am having so much fun with it.  The light blue speaker looks very nice sitting in the living room.  Shipping was fast and no damage.

Aside from all the things the Echo is able to do, we purchased this device for my daughter who is a high school dance major. She has to practice her choreography a lot and is constantly having to stop and go over to her phone to replay or rewind her music. Being able to speak to Alexa and have her pause or rewind a song however many seconds needed has been really helpful to my daughter. It allows her to focus more on her dance without losing momentum or focus. The sound quality is excellent. We have enjoyed using the Echo, as well, for all the other added conveniences a smart device brings to the home and I can see us purchasing a few more in the future.
None

I love my Alexa! It's not perfect by any means. The sync system is off no matter how many times I mess with it. For example, Alexa can turn on the TV no problem. However, it won't actually control the television (like changing channels or turning the TV back off). At the same time, it's AWESOME for listening to music. The sound is incredible! The music selection is vast, too. So, I give it a solid four.

Aun Alexa esta muy elemental en Informacion, le pides música por ejemplo y te envía a que compres app de Musica, la opción libre  por ejemplo de Marc Anthony solo te pone 1 y las demás ni son del mismo genero y nada que  ver con el artista. Por otro lado es simpática, cada vez que le dices Buenos Dias pues te da informacion, canta muy bien y los chicos se divierten en casa y aprenden algunas cosas. Esta en Español es una nueva mejor opción para muchos.

I am a first time Echo owner. It's been nice. It is a great speaker. It also has answers to random questions we have. The kids like asking Alexa for jokes, play games , etc. I like to use it to set timers, and listen to music. I'm sure there are a lot of other features that I don't know about yet. The only bad thing is that when my kindle is in the same room, it hears my voice better when I say "Alexa" and tries to respond. Over all, I'm glad I got it.

The new Echo seems to do everything as well as my Gen 1 unit, but the new speakers provide deeper bass.The one difference I didn’t see as an improvement was that changing the volume manually on the new unit is done by pressing a + or - button instead of turning the rotating ring used on the Gen 1. Using these buttons, especially in the dark, is a hit or miss proposition, especially since there are 4 of them, all the same size, so no way to distinguish by feel. The ring was not only more intuitive, but I always got the desired result. I know that volume can be adjusted by voice, but then you can’t hear the program material as Alexa changes the volume. This is a minor complaint, more of an observation.One thing I really like is being able to synchronize playback on both units. I will probably add a third unit to get music (or whatever) playing throughout the house.

I have to admit I resisted buying one since I wanted to make sure all the bugs were out before I took the plunge. It works fantastic. Truly. I haven't really taken it out for a real "test ride" as of yet. But I will very soon. Right now it's in our bathroom so we have music to listen to when we're in there.The only thing that would make this even better would to have it rechargable since the cord is unsightly.

column2: I’m in love with my new echo third edition
column5: I really love my echo I wish it was compatible with Apple Music.  I was thrilled to know I could make it portable with the portable battery base..yea, now I’m really in love with my echo. I think in the description you should advertise that you can go portable with a a separate purchase of the battery base.  I think that would Encourage more people to purchase the echo making a portable is so convenient.

It’s so nice to walk into my house and with a few words I can turn on my lights, disarm my alarm and play music.  I sleep to thunderstorm sounds, my daughter plays twister w her friends and Alexa”spinning.”  I bought two echo plus and two echo dots... music plays throughout the house.  Only negative is music quality is noticeably less than my Bose but... the convenience of voice control is worth it.

column2: English and Spanish @ the same time, cool!
column5: It is super cool that you can speak both English and Spanish at the same time to Alexa. I honestly thought that was not possible. This is the feature that I appreciate the most, since it is very useful to me when I am asking Alexa to play Cumbias in Spotify. The sound quality is superb, I have linked my echo to My fire TV stick and now when I I'm watching a movie the sound quality improved tremendously, it did the job as a soundbar. So I could say that you can probably call it a "smart soundbar". When I got this gift it included a Smart switch from Kasa and it makes it very easy to turn on and off my room lamp through echo. Overall I can say that I am pretty satisfied with the quality of the sound and the easiness of which Alexa understands both languages.

column2: Amazing what Alexa is able to do
column5: I had a little confusion on my part when installing,.  I had purchased an Echo Dot, believing this was what I needed.Found out I needed the 2 items in order to incorporate the Dot.I guess I need a long cord to connect the two units.Overall, a friendly, helpful, convenient and fun device when I need a quick answer, or an urge to play some music I don't hear anymore on today's radio or TV.

column2: can't use with stereo set up
column5: wasted a lot of money buying 2 echos and a subwoofer that don't play on music unlimited plan unless you pay for the multiple device plan even though your only listening to one song in one place . i think it would be nice if amazon told you that before you bought it. i make a lot of purchases from them every year and am a prime member as well i might start to look elsewhere for my shopping needs. very disappointed would really think twice about wasting your money on this set. would not recommend. amazon support was no help either.
None

I got this mainly to listen to music, especially Christmas music.  I have enjoyed having it so much.  I listen to music all the time and have made specific playlists.  I've asked Alexa questions and have a good time listening to the answers she comes up with.  I like it so much that I bought a second one for the master bedroom.  I love the Twilight Blue color I bought for the bedroom.

It's my first smart speaker and I like it so far. I'm positive that it can do much more than I'm currently asking of it. At minimum, I wanted a clock radio, but this gives me so much more. Since I got it on sale, it wasn't too much more expensive than a clock radio and the sound quality and its capabilities far exceed what a clock radio can offer.  It took a little effort to set it up, but everything works great now.

I recently purchased an Echo Dot for my son and was pleased with the sound for such a small device. I then decided to by this full sized Echo for my wife. The sound is very good. The bass is surprisingly good and the mids and highs are excellent. I can't imagine getting better sound for the money ($59.99 on sale). The voice recognition works well in English. I haven't tried it in Spanish yet.

I am almost totally satisfied with this device. I use it daily and frequently to help me get through the day. I have recently had to put my wife in a memory care facility, because she has dementia. I had hoped she could use the device, but it’s too complicated for her in her condition. She has no short-term memory at this time, and still can’t remember how to operate the device. Also, the change in volume level as music is played, frustrates her. At one moment it is too soft, at the next it is too loud. Too bad it doesn’t have AVC, Automatic volume control such as we have on radios.

column2: The best sounding Alexa enabled device.
column5: I've used Alexa for several years now.. This is my 7th device. The sound quality is amazing with the 3rd gen. The only negative about this device is.. Twice now within a month (while playing music) I have said alexa.. Then the sound faded.. A few shots of static and she becomes unresponsive. Had to unplug and plug back in. This has be here happened with any other Alexa enabled device.

column2: Que venga recargable para usarla siempre
column5: Me gustó puedo mover todos los dispositivos , cualquier pregunta se puede jugar muchas cosas más,  y no me gusto que no escucha bien con el volumen alto , no es recargable  en caso  de se valla usa sólo con Bluetooth.

What I dislike like and maybe someone can answer this - I can call out on Alexa to my contacts and talk to them however, I can not answer in coming calls from my contacts on Alexa.  She states "no incoming call" even though my phone is ringing.  I do like having the ability to listen to music, weather etc. without pulling out my phone or having the TV on.  I would recommend this product highly.

column2: Sky high expectations not met but still pleased
column5: It's clear that the product has evolved since the original echo I purchased way way way way back when. However I I do feel like the speakers are not quite the same quality individually that they used to be. I have seen stereo pairs with the subwoofers sound amazing at what really is a good price for a 2.1 home audio system but I had higher expectations of the individual unit.

I am in love with this generation of Echo! I read several of the reviews before purchasing, and previously have only owned the Echo Dot. Wow. What a major sound quality difference! This has become my go-to for music when I'm cooking, cleaning and in general doing anything that needs some motivation around the house. The bass is impressive for such a small thing - nice deep, non-fuzzing lows with some serious thump I actually felt on the floor. (The Echo is placed on my kitchen table) I ran through quite a gamut of music from Home Free, Post Malone, Star Wars instrumental, a little In This Moment and I was pleased with the quality of them all.If you see this lil puppy on sale - snap it right up!I can't wait to host a party and get this Echo bumpin'!

Love the spontaneous ability to call up music on a whim. I’m not extremely tech savvy so I did have to call in and have help setting it up. That was easy and Amazon gets a 6 star for their help. The unit seems to get lost and forgets what is supposed to be doing. Things like playing more than one song by the artist. We mainly purchased this to play music throughout our home and was unaware there was a limit to “how many” echos connected together. As we purchased a package of 3 echos and a sub. The limit is said to be three, leaving us with a “rouge” echo. Still nice and for the money the sound is great for us. All in all it’s a good product we may just need to know better.
None

I didn't expect this kind of sound coming out of an echo device! I'm seriously impressed!  The sound is crisp and rich and even has some decent bass with out a subwoofer!  And since I bought it on Black Friday, it was delivered to my door at a fabulous price! It basically set itself up so quickly I was almost disappointed that I didn't have to do more!  I highly recommend this product!

column2: Won’t connect with Spotify. Customer support won’t call back.
column5: When it works the sound is great. However, it doesn’t work very often. Sometimes it’ll play when I want to play and then it’ll just stop. Or sometimes the subwoofer will play but then the echo won’t. We have no clue why it does this because customer support won’t call us back. Even though they said they would. So, we are going to return it because this sucks.

column2: Hands down better than the Bose 500 with Alexa.
column5: Hands down voice recognition on the Echo 3rd Gen is way better than Bose 500.I purchased a Bose 500 with Alexa because that wife wanted better audio than theEcho Dot...so I went all in and well we were very disappointed in the Bose voice recognition. But this Echo is spot on and yes the sound quality isn't studio quality but it satisfies the wife.

What a change from my Echo (1st Gen). The sound is amazing out of this small form factor device. I actually enjoy listening to music on it. I especially love that you can change the 3.5mm jack to either Input or Output. That is a very useful feature. I connected an old streaming device to the new echo and I can listen to my music library through the new Echo speaker. This is a definite upgrade from my original 1st Gen echo.I may start upgrading all my original Echos.

I received Alexa as a Christmas gift from my children. I like the idea that I can ask Alexa to play a song that I like without having to use a radio and listen to ads and all kinds of interruptions. This is a wonderful gift that I really love. There are so many things I can ask Alexa, i.e., what is the weather, what time is it, etc. It was easy to set up.

Don't wish to review, I did the trade in for my echo and it was in perfect condition at time of return however once Amazon received it it was rated non-working and in poor cosmedic condition. This negated the 30$ turn in valuse which subsequently overdrew my account. I called and after a bit they refunded my 30$ but did not and would not cover the overdrawn fee of 25$ the support person said she escalated my issue up a level and I have yet to hear back. Now this 25$ overdraft fee has grown to 50$ very unhappy to say the lease

I knew the capabilities of this device before I bought it and of course, that’s why I wanted it. However, I didn’t realize just how much I’d love it! I’m a stay at home mom, so I spend most of my time going from room to room cleaning, folding laundry, etc. I got 2 devices. An Echo for the bedroom, and a Show for the dining room. I like to play music on them. It’s like having in-home surround sound but without the expensive installation! I’ll definitely be getting more echoes to place around my home to amplify the experience.

column2: Great to play music and love mute
column5: I got this to play music while doing household work and cooking.  I love the timer and I love most of the little weather things I get.  I do not have a smart house so it is limited use.  But I do love the sound quality.  I also enjoy that if I do not want anything to be heard I can hit a mute button (not that I have anything to hide).  But love the option.

This is the future? Then I want NONE OF IT. I am a self proclaimed computer/gadget nerd and was waiting for the 3rd generation.  Call this one the POS Generation. This unit continues to ignore my commands. It hears me, blue, yellow then dark. If I wanted to be ignored, I would have stayed married. I have reset reset reset, deleted app, downloaded app, reset reset reset. This thing is about as stupid as my ex. Nice job Amazon. You make me want to go back to Apple which I swore I never would.

Uuufff hey do not hesitate to buy the alexa the best of the best sound quality is the same as the JBL and of the most expensive I already have the 2nd generation and this the 3rd speaks for itself only alexa the best. or and I have in my room the best sound in volvente also very easy to connect just follow the application of alexa and already super easy connection.
None

Most everything is good, easy to use and doesn’t take up much space.  Set up was also easy.  The problem I have been having is a couple of times so far there is static in the speaker and it pops and goes out.  I couldn’t get it to turn off after multiple requests........and then it finally turned off.  The other one I have in the basement has had no problems.

column2: Echo, Get 4. You’re Welcome! It’s good
column5: Work my lights, handles my internet queries, helps organize our lives with timers, calling features and drop ins. I almost forgot the music! Deep bass crisp highs. Sterio pair two of these for a full and excellent sound. Listen with pandora and amazon music as well as others. Get your news and stay private as you please. ECHO. Get 4. You’re welcome.

Love the improvements made on the GEN 3s sound quality, makes our gen 2s sound lacking. Went with the Blue color and very happy. Using 6 echos and 4 dots to provide full house coverage, and they work very well together. The app can glitch a little with the various listening groups, but with a little patience everything is starting to work exactly as it should.

column2: A Fantastic and Convenient Product, but I Have Concerns about Privacy After Seeing a Few Articles
column5: I mostly use this product for listening to music. It's worked for me thus far and adding songs to my playlist is convenient. I'm just a little concerned about the "always on" microphone. Seems like it could easily be used as a wiretap, and judging from some articles, that is a major concern for this product. I'm definitely uneasy about it keeping a record of anything I say, and while the policy claims it's not spying on customers, it's difficult to know if that's legitimately true or just a claim to avoid potential lawsuits.

I loved the first one so much I bought another for my bedroom. I had an Echo dot, but the sound quality isn’t great for playing music. This sound quality rivals my Bose Bluetooth speaker, and turns on easily at my command. I am playing music so much more than I ever did because it’s so easy. Love it.

the quality of this product is very durable. i love the sound quality, and the voice recognition is out of this world! i could be 10 feet away from it and it would probably still pick up my voice. i didn’t like how whenever i asked to play a song it would shuffle play the radio (of that specific song) but that was solved by a connection to spotify (although when i ask to play a playlist, it plays a different playlist made by spotify, for example, even if i said the name exactly). anyways, overall, this is an amazing product! i love how theres games, weather, and even sleep sounds built in to the echo. the only setback is that this needs to be plugged in (if you unplug it, it’ll automatically turn off :c) in order for it to work. i’m extremely satisfied with this version of the amazon echo :))

Since I had an Echo in the Family Room, I decided to buy 2 Echo Dots for the Master Bedroom and the Computer Room to act as intercoms.  I keep the sound at a reasonably level for music, questions, and timers/reminders/alarms, but it is too hard to hear the other room when I DROP IN.  There needs to be a skill that can do multiple steps so I can increase the sound at each end, listen/talk, then set the sound back to the original level when I'm done using  as an intercom.

I just upgraded from an Echo Dot to the latest Echo device, and overall I am quite pleased.  The sound quality is amazingly better for playing music from multiple sources, and interaction with Alexa is also very good.  The only quibble I have is that the new Echo does not seem to recognize my voice commands as easily as the Echo Dot when I am farther away from it; and there are a few commands that, somehow, the Echo does not understand (although the Echo Dot certainly did, and does).  Nonetheless, I am still very pleased I made the upgrade.

I won this in a raffle, I love my new friend! She plays music, answers questions and entertains the grand kids☺️What I don’t like is my 4 year old grand daughter ordered music I didn’t want or need. I wish there was a passcode one needed to complete a transaction. Good news I was able to cancel easily. Amazon is great in this area👍🏽

I got Alexa for radio, pod casts, and the occasional song. Audio is clear and loud with a smaller foot print than the radio/computer. Simply tell Alexa the station ID, and it will change stations.  Before I bought this device, I verified it would work with Windows 7, since it must be connected to a wireless modem using your home computer. (I do not have an i-phone.) When I tried to download the Alexa application software, the download would not finish due to my inadequate web security software. I had to purchase web security software and the help desk cleaned my disk of files I didn't even know I had. My machine runs much faster and Alexa works great. The help desk was very helpful and answered any question/concern I had.  Maybe if I had Apple based computer at home or an i-phone this wouldn't have been a problem??
None

The echo is pretty nice. I bought this primarily for music I dont too much care about the other bells and whistles. The sound quality is great. Bass is pretty good to for a single speaker. I like to voice functions although it doesnt understand something at least a few times a day. I'm super disappointed in the paid Amazon music app though. Not at all intuitive, user friendly, or fun to operate. I'm considering returning the echo for a google home. Google has an excellent music app. Most of my family has the echo so I'm trying to stick with it but.. idk. I'm annoyed daily by that damn music app.

column2: I think I got a bad one
column5: We love our echo when it is working properly. The sound is very good. However,  the echo turns off randomly and doesn't respond to commands.  We listen to a lot of audiobooks.  When asking for audiobooks it has a hard time playing books that are in my library.  For example I'll say "Alexa play magic tree house books 9-16" it does not recognize the book in audible. But instead play a previous book of the same time that it has played numerous times.  It's very frustrating. I have had to unplug it many times because it skips and does not recognize anything. And I've only had it for maybe 2 months.

column2: Very easy to set up, more compact than Gen 1
column5: Setup was far easier than the Gen 1 Echo or the Gen 2 Echo Dots.  It immediately detected our home Wireless network, logged in because the password was already registered with our current Echo setup, and only required some minor customization (change the name and location in the Alexa App).  Speaker sounds better than the Gen 1 Echo too.

I don’t like that Alexa plays the wrong thing after she repeats exactly what i ask of her. It’s really weird. I also don’t like that we have to pay an extra monthly fee to listen specific music from amazon music when you pay all this money for the product you still have to pay extra to enjoy it. Also she was programmed to my voice yet still she listens to everyone who calls her name.
Very upset. I bought new echo 3rd gen. However, it's an inferior quality product. No sound no light on. Ask customer service to replace a new one. Do they test this device before leaving factory?

We needed something in our livingroom with a bit better sound quality than our existing Echo Dot. This certainly filled the requirement nicely. If you don't need the built in hub included in the more expensive model then this is a good choice. We moved our existing Dot into a room we did not care about sound, which worked out nicely

Wont work without cellphone app and only gives error messages.  Have spent hours on this.
