I have another one and it was easy to set up but this one which makes you use iPhone or iPad, would not load.  Also, said the app was not compatible with my iPad!  Better start ironing out the kinks here.  So many people have the same trouble.

I purchased the Echo to go with 3 of the echo dots I purchased earlier this year,  I am still learning all of the things that Alexa can do.  The sound from the Echo is very clear, when playing music I can't tell any doffernce from when we have our stereo on.  The design of the Eho is very nice and looks great on my kitchen island,

This device is EVERYTHING I was hoping for and more. It looks great. Sounds awesome! I have the original Echo Dot. I think most would agree you can’t use that for any serious music playing. I then purchased an Echo Input so that I could hook it up to any serious speaker system. But I wanted something all inclusive. This fits the bill. I’m completely happy with this purchase and I have been telling my family and friends to get one too!

We have a echo dot and I thought this upgrade would be a great Christmas.  I expected the sound to be much better than it is.  From the beginning we have had problems setting it up and it stops playing music a couple times a day.  The ECHO DOT keeps playing on the same internet connection and the ECHO 3rd gen stops.  It may be going back.
None

I wanted a second Echo for a bedroom to be able to play Amazon unlimited music.  I have to say the sound quality on this one is much better than my original Echo.  Much deeper, richer sound.  Got this as a Black Friday deal, so even better.  Love that it was fairly easy to move my smart plugs to it without much of an issue.  Happy with it.

My husband wanted to get an Alexa, but I wasn't so sure.  Well, let me tell you, I have had more fun with this purchase!  I love the sound of the speaker.  The base is amazing, and I didn't think I wanted a lot of base!  I have enjoyed controlling the lights through the Alexa app, and I am constantly asking Alexa questions.  This is such a fun and useful purchase!

column2: It was a big hit at Christmas, and we are all having fun with Alexa now
column5: My wife and kids have seen this at friends and family's homes recently, and were very excited to invite Alexa into the house.  We also have 2 "dots" for the kids rooms, and Alexa is great a playing them bedtime music.  She is currently taking a break from controlling lights, as the X-mas decorations have come down.  However setting that up after everything was opened was quite simple.-Shawn

column2: Easy to use, helpful and FUN!
column5: I love it to easily play music I enjoy and change the volume.  It was a gift intended to help me keep track of medications for a short time period.  It worked beautifully for that.  I like it so much I ordered the Dot for another room. Think I need another Dot now.

My daughter got me Alexa for Christmas and I love it. I listen to music while I'm working and the quality of the sound is great. I'm always making a list for one thing or another and Alexa is great for helping me keep track of everything. I like how all I have to do is tell her to add something to a particular list and she does it.When I am ready to write down the list I just for it and she will tell me everything on it. Best Christmas present ever

From the first generation echo I had. They have certainly Improved on the echo. I do miss being able to turn the top to adjust the volume. But overall sound quality and voice recognition have improved a lot for me. I like the fact that I can have an external aux cable as well if I need it. Overall I’ve been pleased with it.

I am sure I will like the product but cannot believe how this was shipped. It was just put into a packing envelope.  This item is a little more substantial and comes in its own box so in turn it should have come in a bigger shipping box not a packing envelope.  There was a about 4000 pounds of tape and the box for the item was all crushed.  Hope it is not damaged but will not find out until xmas morning.  1 star for packing probably 5 star for product.

very hard to get it up and working.access to get the app.you had to go thru Microsoft to get to it and that was a problem I still don't have the app. other people I know who have this also said it was really bad getting it programed other wise it seems good so far.just don't know how we got it working but will try to get app. again later. need a tech. support contact to get thru this problem.

There is nothing I dislike.  I love how I can tell it to change the tempature in the house, play music, turn lights and fireplace off and on.  Asking questions is the best and savings appointments in my calendar. I even use it to make up my grocery list so I don't have to type it.  So many other things but too many to name.

Works very well. It is not very often it does not understand me. Overall it is a great unit. I have one in each of my bedrooms. The expensive part is getting all the sensors that That you needed to operate Alexa. Each light fan and whatever needs its own receiver. If you can do the electrical part you can save a lot of money by not having to hire it out.
None

What this item for my fiance for Christmas received the first one and would not connect to Wi-Fi set on the phone for 45 minutes with a customer service rep still couldn't get it to work got them to send me another one had the same issue with the new one this time customer service was out of India could barely understand that customer service rep and she was very rude I will be returning the second one I'm done with these

I really like this speaker.  Sounds great for being so small. I have 3 second generation and 1 3rd gen. To be honest I can’t tell the difference between the two. I think they both sound good.  Great to hook up for multi room group. Work on cleaning the whole house and have them playing in all the rooms at the same time.

The product is tons better than the original dot.. they shouldn’t really be compared. But the bass is seriously lacking.. I have a similar speaker in size of this one, and the bass response is much better on that one. Outside of this for lower volume listening like at a desk, or while cooking, this is wounderful!On a side note, I tried to measure the response, it seems that anything below a certain Hz is cut. So the low bass is almost muted.

One of the most fun smart speakers I've owned. This is my first alexa device and boy was I blown by the level at which alexa has reached. With all the smart skills and the 'even better' stupid skills, I have become a fan. Whispering is one cool feature, I just talk to it in whispers now. One thing that I would love to see in the future is able to set a custom word to wake alexa up. I would also want a 'beast mode' or savage mode that would make alexa super sassy like if I ask it who is better, google home or echo it should say 'you think you can get someone better than me? ANSWER IS A BIG NO' and stuff like that. I also wish that I could use stereo mode through bluetooth with ANY speaker rather than just with the same type of speaker, but what I have here is GOLD! love it !

column2: Buy more dots and less echos
column5: I have all types of Amazon Echo products, including dots and subwoofers that have better response then this item. I'm talking about voice command pick up. Overall sound quality is decent but was not really thrilled with the lack of response.

column2: We like this, but think the sound in our Echo Show is better
column5: We got this to add more sound to our house (we have echos in most of our rooms now, but most of them are dots, and we wanted some richer sound in the livingroom.  This is certainly better than the dot, but our echo show in the kitchen has better sound, and I was a bit surprised by that.  Still like this though.
I updated from my echo fist generation to this one. To be honest I trade in my Ins one and now with this one I’m totally regret the change , not significantly changes besides the look.

column2: Great Product! BUT: It has a CLOTH COVER!
column5: I love my new Echo BUT I wish it came in a metal finish!  I have a lot of dust in my home from living on a dirt road and also have a home full of small, long-haired dogs so having an echo with a CLOTH COVER is far from ideal! I anticipate having difficulty keeping this Echo clean!  I'll update as time goes by.

column2: Very disappointed with the upgrade so far
column5: First day after delivery we found out that it stops playing after 20 minutes or less and at times it stops in the middle of a song.  Tried customer support service and it was a nightmare to get them to understand the problem and rectify it.  After several phone calls and emails they agreed to send us a new unit...we are waiting.  Returning the defective unit was another saga I do not wish to pile on

Sound quality is 10x better than echo dot, and voice recognition has improved a lot since the 1st gen. While playing music at max volume, this 3rd Gen Echo will hear me say “Alexa” without making me yell (which is a problem I have with my 1st Gen Echo). If you rely on Alexa to wake you up, I can guarantee you won’t sleep through the alarm on this Echo!
None
Gave it to my father in a senior apartment, placed it in a open faced tv stand. Sounds like an old schooled HK receiver. A+

So far it is great ... we had an old black thin one and this one has so much better sound and better interaction which must be because it can hear better.  Just need to figure out all we can do with it now.

I decided to upgrade to a newer version. I had two gen 1 echos which were still working well. I thought I would trade them in since these were on sale. They came a day earlier than expected and were very easy to set up. I like them as well as I liked the gen 1. They hopefully will last as long and as well.

column2: way better sound and volume than the smaller echo's
column5: these are way better sounding with more volume than the echo dots! that was an important feature because we like music on our roofed screen  porch which has some outside noise, one being the air conditioner compressor. also nice to sync our front Ring doorbell to and when doing so there is no need to buy a Ring chime !
I loved it at first but it stopped working like a month in. I have to return it hopefully. It also never recognizes certain words that I regularly use.

column2: Audio as good or better than the Echo Plus
column5: Replaced an Echo Dot with this in a Master Bathroom and ROCKED this end of the apartment.  Has the same guts as the Echo Plus but in smaller size but I don't detect any loss in audio quality.

Well, it's just sort of creepy, in a way. I like it because I can ask for weather info, order up music..that IS fun. But, when I'm sitting in the living room talking with my hubs and Echo lights up for no apparent reason during conversation, it just feels weird.We turned off the mic but, shrug..

column2: Lots of base tones, most songs
column5: This one is working much better than my old one, SO FAR...Lots of base tones, almost every song...But it does work...Does not play the same tunes as my old one, lots of songs I never heard of before...Same groups. older tunes..??? Classical rock is one area, most tunes not heard before...Just keep on going forward, easy to do with my remote...

I love this item it so nice to tell it a song to play and it plays it. Also when you wake up you can say Alexa what’s today’s news and it starts playing the news when you set it up you can tell it which news station you want to here. You can always ask it what the weather is going to be today and for the rest of the week. There are to many things that it does to write about.
We traded up and we like the new Echo.  We were without an Echo for about 6 months and we missed Alexa.  The sound is much better and the content seems more extensive.
None

Great product. Great sound quality. Ascetically appealing. Works with all my smart home devices. Connects everything together. Overall great purchase. BUT there is one thing I don't like about it. This thing is a speaker. A smart speaker at that. Someone like me with an iPhone cant just open their apple music and click a song and play it over the speaker. Which to me doesn't make sense. But other then that i love it.

column2: Sounds great paired with another echo
column5: This unit is much improved over my first generation Echo, although I do miss the volume ring that was on the original. Voice recognition and the ability of it to hear you over music is much, much better.  Sound quality is also improved, but it goes from good to amazing sound when you pair it with another echo for stereo sound. I paired it with a 2nd gen. Echo plus and it just sounds great! I may add the echo sub at some point but it really doesn't need it once paired and in stereo.

This thing is awesome! I got the echo and two dots for my kids rooms. Its great. I can set individual reminders for each child. I can send reminders from my cell when im working.  Kids love asking questions and listening to music.its great. I can shut off forgotten lights from my cell. Its great...

I already have a couple Echo Dots in my house. I added this one to provide better sound when listening to music. What a great addition to our house. And when I turn all my Alexa devices on together to listen to music, the whole house fills with the sound. I'm planning on getting another big Alexa like this one to add even more great music to our house.

I bought this and was not sure I really wanted it. I mostly wanted a speaker to stream my music while I worked... but oh my god. Alexa is my new love (sorry Siri). One thing I love is how she can add things to my shopping or to-do lists so easily and it goes right into the app. This helps when I lay awake at night unable to sleep because I know I need to make a list of things to do the next day... so I can get it quickly off my mind and go to bed.Well, I loved it so much I bought 2 echo dots. One for the kitchen and one for the kids room so now I can easily drop into the kids room and let them know dinner is ready without having to march up the stairs or scream like a banshee.

I just love it! I am French with a very strong accent. I was concerned that Alexa would not be able to get what I ask for. I have absolutely no problem. Anything I ask is understood right away. I just love that Echo! In term of the sound, I wish I could change the bass. Otherwise, I'm very happy with my new gadget.

column2: 1st gen has better operation overall, disappointed.
column5: I've been a echo owner since the 1st gen... this thing is garbage compared to the 1st gen. Yes, sound quality is way better but it crackles and pops when waking her. It sounds broken, flat out. Tech support says this is normal. Nope, 1st gen did not do this garbage. That's not even the worst part. I use my echos as my preliminary music listening devices. I pay a premium for unlimited and HD music from Amaxon. Both of the latest gen echos I bought randomly disconnect ALL THE TIME and randomly stop playing music for no reason. They're supposed to be new tech, but honestly the 1st gen worked way more flawlessly. Major bugs and kinks that I have zero faith in Amazon addressing before they shove the newest gen dow your throat.

Far better sound than my old Echo Dot (which is now in another room - for playing lower quality music there).  Easy to set up and sounds great.  I also got the battery base for it so I can unplug from power and take out onto the deck and patio when I want my Alexa and music to go.  Nice system.

column2: Doesn't sound as good as hoped for
column5: I replaced an Echo dot with this. The bass has a "tubby" quality to it: a mid-bass hump or two that comes up short of what I was hoping for in terms of sound quality. Re-positioning doesn't seem to help so it's definitely a manufacturing/tuning issue. Otherwise it works fine as an Alexa device.

column2: Lot of tech for the buck
column5: Decided to take the plunge and get an Echo on black friday deal.  I was a bit dubious of how useful it would be, and the jury is still out on that.  Maybe once I hook it up to a bunch of smart devices, its utility will become clearer.  For now, I am impressed with the amount of tech, voice recognition, sound quality in a small package, that you can for a relatively low price.  So far, I'm not disappointed with the purchase.
None

I purchased this to replace my echo dot because I wanted better sound.  This speaker really delivered.  It has a full sound with very good bass.  As a bonus, it seems Alexa can hear me better too.Setup was amazingly easy.  I pulled the speaker out of the box and plugged it in.  It seemed to already know my home network.

The sound quality is really great at this price point - not to mention that once initially paired w/ the app it’s all voice control from there.  There are better speakers out there for sure, and at varying prices, quality and features...but for everything this is, it simply cannot be beat on sale for only 80 bucks!!!  This replaces my Echo dot paired with an Oontz speaker, and I’m also giving 2 as gifts this year now that I know how awesome it is.
I have an Echo Dot, which I replaced with this...….Just plugged it up and it was all set.....Could not have been easier to connect...…..Great product!

column2: Get the app and read the instructions well.
column5: So far I have been using it only for music emails questions Etc. The one that I have now it was a Christmas gift from my son in 2019. Right at this moment I'm going to purchase another one myself. Thank you for asking. About to durability off this item I don't know yet it is too soon to tell.

column2: Love it! The audio quality is great
column5: I have the 1st gen Echo at home, and I use it as a voice assistant as well as a music speaker to stream my playlist on Spotify. I didn't feel like the audio quality of gen 1 Echo is bad at all until I got this 3rd gen Echo. The audio quality improved a lot. Since I have another 5 Echo Dots (3rd gen) at home, I can now enjoy the whole home audio feature by grouping them up. Nice job, Amazon
EASE TO SET UP. YOU CAN TALK IN DIFFERENT LANGUAJES, 100% RECOMENDED
This device doesn’t work periodically and will randomly make beep noises.  Reset it and still continues to do the same stuff

column2: Won't pair with my phone, very bizarre!
column5: This has been the hardest echo device to set up & I've tried everything to set up bluetooth with my phone. Which was a breeze with my other 3 devices. I don't get what I'm missing with this one, but all advice I've found online has been useless. May return if it doesn't pair with my phone!

I got this to upgrade an area in a large room from an Echo Spot to something with a better speaker. This is exactly what I was looking for. The sound is richer and fuller and fills the open space better. I moved the Echo Spot to a bedroom instead and this Echo is perfect in an open concept space.

column2: Echo is great has awesome sound quality & can control stuff in your home!
column5: This speakers is awesome i set it up in my room on my desk where my gaming setup is and the speaker is so nice to have, for music, take a call without my phone, also control stuff if you set it up. I got 2 pairs of led's, one under my desk, & one on the back of my Tv that's on the wall and they work great using your voice with Alexa. The speakers surprised me on how much Bass and how good it would play the high's and lo's so, I had to order another Echo lol so I can pair them on my desk & use them as Computer Speakers or just have them for a surround sound and stereo system. Definitely a nice purchase and they always have some room to improve which I won't doubt they will.
None

column2: It keeps turning off every few hours and I can't get any help figuring it out.
column5: the  Echo 3 is attractive, unobtrusive and has great sound.  I hoped to use it for background music in my office waiting room but it keeps turning off every few hours.  I can't find anything online that helps me fix the problem - I am told it's my connection but multiple other internet connected devices are having no issues.  Same with Amazon help.  Someone said there was  a firmware upgrade but I've not found it.

First buyer and user of such a product. Very easy set up. Outstanding sound quality for music. I bought this one for in my bedroom to try it out during our kitchen remodel. So impressed I am keeping it in the bedroom and buying another one. Installed smart switch and the unit picked it up and works turning lights on and off.

column2: As arrival, the bass was set very low. After readjustment the sound quality is sub par.
column5: I am hearing impaired with hearing aids. This unit has absolutely poor sound quality. Could not distinguished the broadcasted speech. After much frustration,  donated to a day care center classroom. A better Investment would be into a separate speaker combined with the smaller echo dot.
We had an Echo Dot but upgraded it. This one is awesome!!  The sound is way better then the dot. We love it!  Very happy we upgraded.

It was easy to set up. We don't have but one "smart" device set up but it's fun to play with. At this point it's just a toy. Amazon had an offer for new Echo buyers for a 99cent smart plug which we took advantage of. We're using it for our living room table lamp. Like I said, it's fun!

Works great!  Answers questions, tells jokes, and plays music. Times your lights off and on while you’re away. Turns on your bedside lamp when the alarm goes off. Can be programmed for one time, by the day, for weekdays or weekends. Will choose a playlist for you or order from Amazon! Can’t wait to learn more.

The Echo was easy to set up and was working in a matter of minutes. We’re enjoying discovering all it can do. We bought some smart plugs and those too were easy to get up & running.Lots of good music we’re enjoying also. The jokes are pretty corny, which is funny in itself.

Being new to this device, I have not fully utilized the full functions.  Was reasonable easy to set up out of  the box especially for old people like me.  Voice recognition is good, sound is great, and I really like the ability to get Alexis to play any variation of music I request.  Whether by artist, exact song, or general categories.  No more changing of CD's or finding music to play.

Nice, now I need one for the other room. Although I paid for upgraded Amazon music, I can’t get any of the music I like on it, so have to look into other subscription services. But it was easy to set up w only one call to customer service. And I am totally hopeless with technology.

column2: I was Skeptical...but my wife wanted it.
column5: It is my wife's favorite Christmas Gift.  This is our first one...and I have to say I am impressed....Of course she has it say "Good Morning my Queen" when she gets up.  So funny.  But it works great.  Sounds amazing...now we will start moving forward with other goodies for this.
None

Easy access to news, information, music and even entertaining jokes. I'm still becoming familiar with all the things I can do with Alexa. I don't have any home functions connected, such as thermostat, lights, etc., so I can't comment on it although it seems to be something handy to have. I was disappointed to not be able to download the app to my phone. It just wouldn't work for some reason. However, I successfully got connected with my laptop.

I had one of the very 1st Echo's, but it did not survive my granddaughter's oops this Christmas. Bought the new one and it's even better !!  The sound quality is great, and the continued new things Alexa can do is also great. She is almost kinda part of the family, as we call her name numerous times every day.

Since I didn't own the previous generations, I have nothing to compare it to.  However, never owning one before, I can honetly say that the sound quality for such a small device is huge.  It also works well with my Harmony Hub to operate nearly everything in my home, on command.

I upgraded from 1st Gen.  to the 3rd Gen. due to newer hardware and because the 1st Generation wasn’t working as smoothly.Set up was super easy. If you are up grading, there no need to type in your network info. Because your info is already in your account  The Echo tech that helped me was very patient and worked with me for over 2hrs. He went above and beyond. We tried every situation to hook the 1st Gen to the different groups of speakers. Firgured that there was something wrong with it. Or, it was getting to old.3rd Gen sounds even better than the original ECHO

column2: Avoid for Now - Playback Problems Hold This Device Back
column5: Intermittent playback issues plague this device. Amazon replaced the first one, only to have the same issues with the new one. I might just return it and find something else. It’s a shame. Our 2nd and 3rd gen Echo Dots work really well. Hopefully they can work these issues out.

Just love Alexa products.  This is the THIRD Alexa in this home and one Echo Dot too.  The Dot is OK, but no match for sound quality from these Echo devices.  Bought two LED bulbs for the front room, they were a pain to install from that company, but they got us through it and Echo turns on/off and dims the lamps on command.  All devices also tell us if someone is @ the front door.

I like the functionality and Alexa providing "tips" to make operations simpler. At the same time, I just got it so am trying to figure out what commands will allow me to "turn on music with a timer of 8 hours". It seems Alexa may have some difficulty with multiple commands.  She either sets the music or sets the timer, but I haven't been able to get her to understand what I think is a simple "play music for 8 hours" command. Also, the yellow light "notifications" sometimes get caught in a loop with this odd sound until I ask Alexa to play notifications.  I can probably control this in settings.

The sound quality of the speaker is quite amazing considering the size. Alexa's voice is also pleasing.The playlists that are available are just superb. Also, Alexa was able to answer absolutely any question we have asked.Great for local weather forecasts as well.

Great sound quality that fills a room beautifully. Music sounds crisp and bass is perfect. Also, Alexa is pretty awesome. It was a little difficult for me to figure out how everything worked at first, but as you play around in the app, it becomes clearer. Very happy with this purchase!

We had the 2nd Gen for a few years and we loved the volume control twist at the top.  The 3rd Gen does not have that twist control, but the sound quality is much better than the previous Gen.  We do enjoy this product and it is a great value, especially if you pair it with  Fire 4k.
None

This is an excellent device with great sound quality.  I recently added this to my stable of echo dots and one echo plus.  Fast and easy setup since I already have all of those other Alexas known to my WIFI.  I bought the blue one.  It looks more gray than blue but whatev.

column2: Much more sensitive to hearing your voice...better bass
column5: The sensitive microphones pick up your voice much better than the echo dot. Alexa can hear your commands even if playing loud music.  For its size, this has room filling sound with a nice balance of lows and highs.  Excellent for music playback. Highly recommend this device.

WOW!That is the first thing once i heard the sound quality coming from this new 3rd gen. Echo. A 100% improvement from 2nd gen, and there is nothing terribly wrong with the 2nd gen either, its just the took it up a few levels with the sound on this model.Now I have only had this a few hours, so if my opinion changes which it more than likely wont, or if more things I discover about the new gen. I will try to update.

I replaced a Gen 1 Echo with this new model. The installation was as easy as logging in and it self configured.  I didn't voice train it but I don't have any problems with response. Overall, the sound is a bit softer than the other and the look doesn't stand out. So far I like it.

Traded in my 1st gen model for this one.  Nicer styling, sounds fuller, mics pick up my voice better and further.  Even has a audio in/out jack which 1st gen lacked.  Only con is midrange could be stronger, even after equalizing in the Alexa app.  Overall, very satisfied.

I purchased a dot a year ago as a way to enter into the smart speaker venue. I couldn’t believe how much we ended up using it. My family listens to music a lot, and I thought this would be better to have in the kitchen, which is a larger area. The sound is better than the dot (although I was still impressed with the dot), the bass is deeper and I feel like it has a bigger range. I would recommend this for anyone wanting something a little more than a dot for music.

Indiscutiblemente me enamoro mi Echo alexa es lo mejor que pudieron inventar, buen sonido te ayuda en muchas cosa este aparato me encantó tanto que ya llevo tres comprado,uno para mi hijo uno para mi hermana y el mio😀 de verdad se lo recomiendo totalmente

column2: Bad audio makes echo 3 a pretty poor upgrade
column5: Super sad..... I have about 8 Amazon smart audio devices. Clearly I drink the Alexa koolaid but..... The sound on the echo 3 just sucks.  They got everything else right as an upgrade but the muffled audio is painful to the ears.True shame.  Almost a throwaway :(

column2: Good sound quality but basically another voice search app
column5: Likes - good interaction with Amazon account IE - playing music  -Excellent sound quality  -Very easy to set up and use,Dislikes - tries to sell me more stuff  - limited AI more like a good voice search tool with links to Amazon features and plug in home apps.Good value for price, I was hoping for a higher level  of AI, still a good tool, particularly with the Amazon interface

column2: Glitches consistently with the app and with understanding what you say to it.
column5: We had a lot of trouble getting her to connect to Spotify and Apple Music instead of Amazon Music. We gave up after a bit and tried again after an update and then it worked. The echo also gives you a lot of ads after using an app, and we have to constantly tell her to stop even though we have tried to set preferences to have that feature off.Also, the app glitches a lot.
None

I love this year's new echo!  I upgraded my unit from the original Echo 1st generation and wow, I am very impressed.  The unit has deep base and is able to hear me from about 25 ft. away without having to yell!  I am happy with this unit and recommend it for future buyers.

Great upgrade from previous versions. Tech support is lacking severely. When calling you get indian support that is extremely basic. The speaker itself is great high treble and low bass not too big and not too small. Looks great in any setting with the color options.

Frrequently shouts out that its connected to my computer. Returning this until an option is added to turn this ANNOYING "feature" can be turned off in Settings.Amazon has known about it for years now, and hasn't lifted a finger. Whoever put it on the Echo should be fired.

We got a black friday deal on the Echo 3rd gen and are happy with it for the price we paid.  It sounds good and is easy to set up like all other amazon products.  My only complaint is that Alexa is behind Siri and Google when it comes to understanding questions and responding correctly.

This product is excellent.  Such a great sound.  I only listen to music with my Alexa.  I also have her in my car.  I will get rid of Sirius radio, as I have many playlists.  The problem is that I'm too dependent on using Alexa.  I have one in each of my rooms in my house.  Fantastic product!!

Purchased myself a Christmas gift when it was on sale.  I am enjoying deciding the type of music to listen to, and the convenience of turning on my chair-side lamp without having to get up.  (I purchased a smart plug combo.)  I love the blue color, as well.  Color options were a smart marketing decision...

column2: Voice sync issues with Samsung TV
column5: When linked to my Samsung TV via Bluetooth, there is about a 1/2 sec delay between the picture and the sound. The TV has an audio delay adjustment for "compatible audio devices". Apparently this device is not compatible.  It's too bad because the sound is amazing.

I love my Alexa! The sound quality of this speaker is great. It doesn’t sound crackly when you turn it up all the way. The voice commands work perfectly especially with other devices connected like my smart bulbs, switches, & even my Roku tv! I have an echo dot as well & they work great paired up so that I can listen to music in multiple rooms at the same time. 2020 is cool 😎
This one replaced my original Echo. At once, I was surprised at the improvement in sound. Definitely it's a value to buy.

I received my Alexa as a Christmas gift and I love it! I had been wanting one for a long time! I love being able to play music just by asking Alexa and the thunderstorm sounds is so relaxing! I know there’s much more you can do with it and I intend to try it all!
None
Alex can hear me better when I say her name over music or noise. I don’t have to speak louder which is nice.  Better sound than my 1st generation.

column2: Impressive sound quality and super simple setup!!
column5: Love our new Echo! We upgraded from the smaller Echo Dot b/c we read the sound was better in the Echo. My son listens to music through it all the time. Setup was extremely simple and as soon as we got it going we were totally impressed!! Music sounds even better than expected!

column2: All-new Echo (3rd Gen)- Smart speaker with Alexa
column5: Amazon is the only way to go when you need to purchase that product you’re looking for at a great price. Shipping is very quick and your product is packaged for protection.  Products work as advertised and meets or exceeds my expectations. Highly recommend Echo Smart Speaker!!!

I must say this is an excellent product. The sound and quality are superb! I would definitely buy more if I had a larger place. You can sync up anything on Amazon/Alexa/even bluetooth! The ability also to see what it would look like in your place was very very helpful!

Best Christmas gift I've gotten in years!.  Love the convenience of finding information.  Especially like listening to music.  Never expected the great sound quality.  Like the responsiveness to my voice even at a distance.  Will definitely purchase as gift for others.

The sound on this thing surprised me for its size. I keep the volume between 5-7 out of 10 max, and that's loud and clear enough to fill my medium-sized living roon. Alexa works great, and no complaints there. It would've been nice if it had an internal rechargeable battery, but also makes sense to keep it in your house plugged in the whole time.

column2: Can’t truly play in stereo with Bluetooth
column5: Sounds quality is good. But I purchased so I can link them as is self described for the Echo. Stereo sounds basically. Well that worked, but if you are using Bluetooth to listen to music from your phone, it does not play on both Echo’s in stereo. It only plays on one. That needs to be redesigned.

Nothing is perfect really, but this is a pretty cool device. It actually does a lot more than I really thought. I got it as a gift for my husband who is super techie. It has a lot of cool features that we plan to take advantage of. I suggest putting it on its own network just so that it's more secure.

Alexa is new to us. We couldn’t believe what great sound it gives us and how easy it is to use. Very impressed. So much so - that we got a second echo dot for our kitchen, a larger echo for the living room, an echo show 5” for our bedroom and an echo auto.

Super disappointed! We upgraded our original Amazon Tap for the Echo. I was after a few of the features like drop-in and better sound BUT then I went to go grab Echo and bring her outside as I often do with my Tap and it DOESN'T WORK!!! I guess it has to be plugged in?!? I am SO SO disappointed.
None

column2: Easy to Use Easy to Install Broad Versatility
column5: This is my first Echo / Alexa unit. I found it easy to use and easy to install. The unit has broad capability and it seems that virtually all of the Smart Technology are scrambling  to get on the “Alexa Band Wagon” causing wider versatility in its ability.

There is absolutely NOTHING not to love about this echo. We use it allllll the time. For reminders. Lists. Music. Questions. Even calling my contacts in my phone. There's so much. Alexa has definitely made things easier for us. I recommend it to everyone.

I have been a prime member for a good 3-4 years now and i’m just now starting to get into the Echo ecosystem. I recently visited a friends house with a SONOS system and was very impressed with the quality/immersion and how you can play music throughout the entire house. However, I did NOT want to spend upwards of a GRAND on a couple speakers. The Echo speakers are not only a fraction of what a SONOS system would cost, but they provide MORE features than the SONOS.Thanks Amazon you’ve done it again. Very happy with these smart speakers. It’s even better with the Echo Sub! ;)

Using it mainly as a music system even though I know it can do much more. My favorite thing about it is if I have a song in my mnd, I can ask Alexa and hear the song immediately,  in most cases. Sometimes you have to be subscribed to their premium music service to hear a certain song.
It doesn’t work as well as the one that I got previously, the sounds is not as good, I have to make more then one request of the same command. I’m not as happy with it as the one I got years ago.

column2: Nice Update; I miss twisting the volume ring.
column5: Sounds pretty good.  I am looking forward to getting a Studio some time.  There was a bit of base rumble, but I put a few felt pads on the bottom and all is well.  I still prefer the volume ring, but I guess that I will get over it sometime.  I do like the size better than version 1.

The Echo is easy to set up and use. I started using it with Amazon Music, which comes with Amazon Prime, that I have not had the chance to use until now. Now I don't know how I could have lived without Echo for so long. Perfect Christmas gift for myself. Love it.

column2: A few quirks, but fine overall
column5: This technology will continue to evolve and become easier to customize.  I use it mostly to play SiriusXM in the house without the need for a second subscription or equipment.  Every now and then Alexa doesn't quite understand some request, but nothing major.  You can't expect it to know much past its programming.

I had an earlier Alexa product that I loved.  Once it was uncharged I could unplug it and carry it around the house with me.  I used it for music and news, mostly, as well as occasional info queries.  I am disappointed with this new Echo.  It has much better sound quality than the old one.  But it is bulky and heavy and does not have a battery.  So I find myself rarely using it.  When I do unplug it and carry it to a new outlet, it takes too long to charge up and become responsive.  I will need to get a battery attachment, but that will only add more bulk & weight -- and cost!

Great value and works excellent.  Bought this to replace our echo dot in the living room and we are pleased with the upgrade.  I love that it is still small and compact and can fit on our shelf.  The mic seems to be more responsive than the echo dot also.
None

column2: Better sound than previous gens (in my opinion)
column5: Nice color choices, and I like the new size/form-factor as well. I have one of each gen, including the dots, and this has the best sound in my opinion. It has less fullness than the Sonos One I also have, but still nice in a small-to-mid sized room.

column2: How did I do without Alexa???
column5: Alexa was exactly as described.  The sound quality is outstanding.  I've already created Playlists, Reminders and directions, i.e., "Alexa, turn off the Living Room Lights".  Alexa is fabulous.  I don't know how I did without her for so long.  I'm still expanding her capabilities.

column2: Big improvement over the Echo Dot.
column5: Music sounds much better than the echo dot.  You can actually hear the base notes and the sound doesn't break up much at all.  I do hear more distortion on the echo dot.  We have this in the kitchen and the carries very well throughout the first floor.  I gave it 4 stars since I am looking for even better sound.  Would need a bigger system for that.
I cant get it to connect. I also have google home and it took 60 seconds to download the app, connect to bluetooth, and use. I've been trying with thisnalwxa for 30 minutes and all it does is load.

This is our 5th Alexa product.  We are hooked!  I've also gifted Alexa devices to 5 different people.  Once you have it, you'll never know how you did without.  If you are concerned with security, turn off the microphone when you're not using it.

column2: Great speaker with a serious flaw.
column5: The sound quality is excellent and the Alexa function is great. However, there is one serious flaw of the echo. When playing music over Bluetooth, the volume is extremely low. It needs to turn all the way up to have a reasonable volume for music. But by then, the Alexa volume is way too loud. Sadly, there is no way to sync the volume level of the music and Alexa. Another minor glitch is when playing amazon music to stereo pair of echo, there is always a few seconds of noise before the music starts. It would be to mute them before the music starts.

Definitely an upgrade in sound quality from my Echo first generation. I was expecting a little more low end from the speaker, but it's not bad. Also does not respond as easily as Gen one, so I have to speak louder, but not bad at all. I love the look and ease to set up. Currently considering the Echo Studio.

column2: Nice improvement over the Echo 1.  The sound has more depth and richness.
column5: The new Echo has a much deeper and richer sound than the original Echo.  It was very easy to connect with my WiFi  We switched from black to twilight Blue and prefer the new look.  Very happy.  What I would like to see is for the App to be more user friendly and intuitive.

column2: Love this new 3rd Gen Echo! Excellent sound
column5: Has a GREAT sound. Excellent for music now. Was able to pair a headset. I needed some tech support, called Amazon & was able to resolve my issue & also helped me pair a Bluetooth headset, which works great.I love the new Dolby 360 sound.

The speaker works as described.  But, I unplug it when not in use.  I understand that it records your conversations.  And, you have no way to delete or access what it records.  Can we believe that little red button keeps it from recording us?
None

When I first got this item as a gift, I thought it was really cool.  A few days later, Alexa did not respond to my voice at all.  The lights came on but shut off immediately after I asked her to play some music.  Last night, I asked her to play a specific artist.  She stated that she could not unless I pay, but she could play something similar.  The entire hour she played something similar, the music was static, and came in and out.  Have called my son several times since he gave me the item as a gift.  He said he didn't know why the item would be acting up.  No longer amused by this item.

We got this for my mom for Christmas because she has vision problems and it was hard for her to see the time and with this she can ask her what time it is and any other information that she needs that she can’t really see to find out. She loves it she’s always asking it questions and playing music on it.
This sound quality is solid and is exactly the improvements that were needed from previous generations.

column2: Good, but the Amazon streaming still has issues.
column5: Impressive sound. Bought as Echo Dot replacements in 2 rooms. The old tinning and low volume of those Dots were killing me. These give much better bass and treble, seemingly better than my 2nd Gen Echos.However, if Amazon can't keep these things from randomly stopping my music streaming for no reason, I will be replacing all 7 with Google's home!!!! devices.

If you don't have an Alexa you're missing out. Shes super handy and great at reminding me about everything! She's also super helpful in the kitchen. She helps you with timers, conversions, recipe place holders, etc. She also plays great music anytime you ask her! I would say my most favorite feature is the Good Morning Alexa command that I set up. She turns on the lights and goes through a set of tasks that I made her do.

The sound quality when combined with Amazon music is absolutely top shelf. I usually purchase bose speakers but I must say this is same as or greater than in quality! My advice is that after you buy it you go into the settings and tweet the bass up just a bit.

Sound quality is much better. The form factor is more attractive . All the great functionality with more features added daily is great. Pair this device with AnyList for keeping lists for groceries and tasks across all your Apple devices

column2: Overall really good sound, 3rd gen doesn't seem to pick up voice as easily as 2nd gen does
column5: Looks cool in blue with white controls.  Overall very good sound, Base is good, you can "feel" as well as hear the power.  The voice command feature doesn't seem to pick up my voice as effectively as 2nd generation Echo does.  Doesn't seem to get my requests as accurately either.  Overall fun device though, with good sound.  It's been cool to "pair" the 2nd and 3rd gen Echo in different rooms in an "everything" group for sound that fills the house with great sounding background music.  Not to mention the endless other features and skills these devices have.

Given to my grandson for his room...’he plays music and games, he turns the lights on and off and loves the multiple sleep noises...loves it and it’s great for calling him downstairs when I have dinner ready or need the garbage taken out😏

These are much better than the echo dotGreat sound and easy to connect. This also has a much better sound than the Google Home which is one of the reasons I purchased it. Find music and Apple Music are skills and are easily used
None
Much better sound than my 1st generation Echo. Better looking device as well. Can’t beat the trade in of an old device to upgrade price.

column2: Replaced an occuring Sirius XM bill
column5: I use my Echo 99% just for music so far...I was able to cancel one of my satellite accounts bc now I can play it thru Alexa. I like that I can set my station and then turn off the microphone for privacy. Overall I'm glad I went for the Echo

Quedé completamente perplejo hasta donde sabía era bueno porque ya amistades me lo habían recomendado hasta que lo compré ,sin duda un instrumento que a demás de útil es buena calidad en soporte,en sonido,fácil de usar,recomiendo este artefacto si para la utilidad del hogar es lo que buscas

column2: So much Fun and very Useful!
column5: Love the 'new' Echo 3 Gen., the set up was so easy and quick. I purchased the Amazon Smart Plug so Alexa-Echo can turn the lamp on and off when I enter and leave my living room. The speaker sounds amazing! So happy with my purchase.

Absolutely love this when it’s working properly! It has great sound when working but there are sometimes volume issues (Music volume is almost silent when all the way turned up but then Alexa voice is extremely loud) . I’ve also had issues with the lights on the Alexa. They consistently stay on even when I’m not talking to her and also when there are no notifications. After leaving unplugged for a few hours it comes back on and works fine, I just wish I didn’t have to keep resetting it. It will sometimes go a day or more without working properly.

The echo will do alot of things.  The most important things has to be programmed into it.  Programming it isn't the easiest thing to do.  It would have been nice to have some instruction on how to program certain things to the echo.  A lot set up can be done through the app, but not all.

column2: Cant sync music to other ones
column5: They really need to add the ability to pair and sync music on them. Its a shame I cant have all of my alexas as a sort of sound system throughout the house. Very disappointed. As for sound quality on this thing? Its superb

column2: My radio didn't work well so I use this and Alexa to listen to local stations
column5: When you live a long way from a radio station it is hard to get a solid and consistent signal. The station I like is available on Alexa and it works great that way.  The sound is better than the old radio and I enjoy this device.

It is as I had thought, a very good, and competent smart speaker. I didn’t rate the tech support as I Haven’t needed to use it. The sound quality needed some adjustments to fine tune it for my taste. Overall I am happy with my echo 3.

column2: Echo 3rd Generation is a great speaker
column5: My Echo Show is in my kitchen, and I set up the Echo 3rd Generation speaker in my living room as an additional speaker when I'm playing music.  But I've also found that it's handy for other Echo related tasks like answering questions.  The sound qualify is not 100% as good as the qualify of the Echo Show, but it comes pretty close.  I'm very satisfied with this speaker.
None

I bought the speakers to go along with my existing Echo. According to the installation instructions this won’t work. The instructions are not clear. I think the only one that understand the instructions are the product people that wrote them. It shouldn’t be that hard to pair 3 Echos with Blue tooth  Also why should I pay for a subscription for iTunes when what I want to listen to my own music from my iPhone ?

I wish I would have purchased this speaker a long time ago 🙄 I have really been missing out. I’m not a speaker “guru” but it gets pretty loud and sounds great to me and that’s all I need. I also love that I can use Alexa too! I have the charcoal color and I would definitely recommend.

column2: Very good sound, especially playing music. Could use some tweaking.
column5: Sound is very good for size of the device. Can make some adjustments to sound with equalizer on app.  Cons: 1-volume slider on app disappeared, so I have to either ask Alexa to lower the volume of the echo plus or manually adjust the volume. 2- can't listen to movies with two paired echo plus devices. You can only use one speaker when playing videos or watching movies.

column2: Great Product, 2nd one we have purchased
column5: We love then. We connect them to devices in our home. The sound quality is great for music. We have Amazon Prime Unlimited for full music catalog so we play any music we want on voice command and the sound quality is very good.

It was a gift and we were hesitant to plug in this always listening device. After preventing it from sending this out and kknowing to keep the mute button pressed, we gave it a shot.  Works well adding items to grocery list, playing most music (it is a travisty it won't stream silent night by the Temptations), answering some questions albeit from a liberal viewpoint.
Perfect, is the only word that comes to mind. the compact design is a welcomed upgrade.

The sound quality is excellent for music on this item. I can interact with it very well. I can play games with it, program to tell news, weather, and so many other things. It can turn certain things on when I tell it to. Overall I have my moneys worth on this item.

column2: I love my new friend Alexa!
column5: I absolutely love Alexa. Not only can she play me all my favorite songs but it is almost like having another friend. I can ask her the weather and trivia questions. I love how she- yes I consider Alexa as a person- answers me.

column2: Like getting a new member of the family to talk to.
column5: Works well, was easy to setup after downloading Amazon Alexa App. It takes awhile to learn features. I've only had it since Christmas, but am constantly adding things to use with it, such as Pandora, TuneIn, iHeart Radio, Sirius/XM.Also had a Echo Dot I hadn't used yet, but set it up in a list of "Everywhere" devices, including Amazon Fire, so I can listen throughout the house. A decent internet connection is a must, so location is important. Sound quality is good for its size. I need to figure a way to tie it into my stereo system. That would be awesome.

She works well have to say play everywhere group to fill the house. Tried play on all speakers etc. neighbor put a tag on it to remind old folks no no problem. She smarter then I know but learning . Get the base unit for music.
None

I bought this as a gift for my daughter, she was hesitant initially; said she didn't think she would even use it.  She loves it and uses it mostly for the Amazon music library.  This Echo 3rg generation has excellent sound.

column2: Alexa is my writing partner and so much more
column5: I just upgraded from a first gen Echo plus and I’m blown away by the sound improvements.

I’m really impressed with the quality of the speaker(s).  Way better than my Bose portable or JBL.  And soooo easy to set up & use.  Alexa is very helpful.  I bought mine on Prime Day so got a great deal.  I highly recommend.

column2: Modest Improvement Over the Original Echo
column5: Liked the size (smaller) and appearance (fabric vs metal) better than the original Echo. Didn’t perceive a significant difference in sound quality. Prefer the twistable ring on the original to the button on the new one to adjust the sound.

I like everything except there is a bit of a learning curve adapting to Alexa’s language.  But I am quickly catching on.  So far what I like the most is knowing when packages are sitting on my front porch.  I worry a lot about those buggers who sneak up and steal my stuff.

column2: Hate it but my Hubby wants to keep it.
column5: It's what he wants for outside in the garden during the summer. Ok, fine. Right now it's unplugged, mute and deaf. As it should be. Creepy af these things listening all the time. All. The. Time. No matter what they tell you this thing is collecting your info.

I love this echo. It is an improvement over the first and second generations in term soft sound quality. Voice recognition is good and it looks nice. I have first and second generation devices and this is the best one.

Sound seems a little muffled.  Bass is adequate treble is a little lacking in clarity.  Be prepared when adding a new device however in reenablinhs skills and such. It is a fight to get the amazon devices to work together.

Traded in my old 1st Gen Echo for this. Love the color and smaller size. Less obtrusive in the living room. Seems to hear and understand commands better over previous unit. It doesn’t randomly state “I’m sorry, I’m having trouble with your request” when it overhears something on the TV.

column2: Good value for money,  and SOUND...
column5: Alexa Echo always understands my words. And the speaker performance of this product seems to be good in echo.The bass of the sound is similar to BOSE speaker. However, the balance between the treble and bass at high treble is broken. Therefore, it is not suitable for the purpose of listening to loud music.For that, I recommend buying Sonos One for listener to loud music.
None

I am primarily using the device to play music, and like the sound quality, but sometimes the device just shuts down in the middle of the song.  The only remedy I have found is to turn the device off/on so it reboots.  I assume it loses internet connectivity, which makes sense, but shouldn't the device be smart enough to sense that and reconnect (like a smartphone does)?

This product sits in our kitchen and is a wonder.We are very satisfied with all the classical music and abilities of device..Had no idea how to set it up. Arrived in mail. I called a telephone number for setup by them.

column2: Great sound will buy for a. Xmas gift
column5: I finally upgraded from the first serious the price I couldn't pass on
Es maravilloso,me gusta para escuchar el estado del tiempo,ya que que es muy rápido y todo tipo de musica,entre otras cosas.lo recomiendo .

I loved the sound on my 2nd generation Echo but this 3rd generation has a noticeably better sound quality. Or maybe its just louder....either way I am getting some serious use of the Amazon unlimited music all around my house.

Alexa is new best friend.  No problem with setup, sounds great.  Voice is very clear and voice range is a good 20 ft talking normal. I highly recommend, ordering a echo dot for kitchen.  Alexa is fun to use & very helpful.

I always thought about buying one but didn't jump on it until I received my echo dot for free with another purchase. After a few days I was hooked. I'm so glad I got in on the (RED) edition before they were sold out!

I'm pleased with most features of the all new red-edition echo (3rd gen); however, I was disappointed with its color which is more a dusty rose or raspberry rather than crimson. I was expecting (hoping for) something more candy apple or strawberry. Otherwise, I'm satisfied. I think Amazon should replace the muted hue with one more eye-popping.

I ordered the blue version. The color in person is darker, and not nearly as attractive, as that pictured. Looks like slightly faded denim when reflecting its blue tones. Otherwise appears medium grey. I would have ordered the sandstone had I known the blue was so dark. Very disappointed. Sticks out like a sore thumb in my bedroom. On a positive note, the speaker is decent and a noticeable improvement over the 2nd generation.

column2: Alexa needs a little bit more work
column5: I wish Alexa had the capability to communicate your issues with customer service pertaining to ordersAnd then receive a notification resolution to the issueAlexa could be far more useful compared to what she is now
None

column2: loved it so much gave it to my elderly parents and bought another
column5: great device, worth a few extra bucks and buying this over the dot. saying "Alexa" does sound better than saying "ok google"  great sound and so many many skills being added daily .  i highly recommend this device.

column2: Sum up my review. You are lucky I wrote anything at all.
column5: I like the unit, but I really resent being expected to do anything other than rate it with stars.

Love the blue color but I wish Alexa had MORE options in sound volume. If Alexa is too loud and I say "Alexz lower volume slightly" or by only one decimal then Alexa volume drops way too low. This is VERY disappointing.

I purchased this echo to add another in my living room.  I have three speakers that are linked in the house, now.  The sound is good and I like the ability to play music On the main floor of the house with my voice.

column2: Nice but not what I was looking for
column5: I ordered 2 Echo's to use as wireless speakers in my retail showroom and ended up switching to JBL Flip instead. The sound quality on the Echo doesn't compare to the Flip and while I enjoy the voice recognition features when purchasing speakers sound quality is the most important.Sound on the Echo is good and works well in small rooms but it just doesn't compare.

This purchase is my second Echo unit.  I'm very pleased with it.  Everything works the same as with the other Echo unit I have.  So setting it up and operating it is a breeze.  The sound, which is paramount, is great.  I'm happy with my purchase.  I can even synchronize the two units.  Great.

I gave this as a Christmas present and it was a hit. I wasn’t completely sure if I could set up another device through the app on my phone  as I already have one at home too. But it Was a quick and easy process.

Nice item. I just use it for streaming music. The sound quality is good, not great. The microphone picks up my voice well, but it doesn't always play what I ask for. In general, I am pleased with this purchase.

The sound coming from the speaker most of the time is exceptional.  However the base in some jazz music is a loud buzz.  Sounds like a wire is loose from the speaker face.  I know that is not possible because this is an electronic speaker.

This 3rd generation Echo is awesome. Blends easily with any decor.  The sound is fantastic when playing music.  I had a 1st generation echo and it saw me through 7 years. I would definitely recommend this product to everyone.
None

Love my new echo.  I use it to listen to music and the sound quality is great.  I also use it to communicate between floors..saves me lots of steps.  I use it as a timer when I cook, for a wake up alarm, I ask Alexa questions, etc.  It’s great!

column2: Wait till it goes on sale
column5: Not as good at voice recognition as my first generation echo. I like the design of the first one better because you can see the light bar better. We bought it because it was 1/2 off but if I had paid full price I would have returned it

column2: Alexa makes a nice addition to your home.
column5: I am new to the Alexa thing, but I am currently enjoying it very much. I already had her on my Fire tablet,  and my phone, just had not used it. Now I find myself talking to her all the time. Wonderful device.

I love this  echo , music sounds great! But I’ve noticed that songs get cut off early sometimes and I also hear it make a sound which I don’t know why. I’m new to using this so there is a lot for me to learn.

I have 2 of the first Echos and 3 echo dots and needed 1 more for a room that did not have one. My Wife needed it so that room would have music when she wanted it Merry Christmas to my wife. And she loves it

Loving the new Echo! I ordered it in Twilight Blue and it looks awesome on my bed side table. The audio is amazing, crystal clear sound with lots of base. The sound quality rivals the surround sound in my living room. I might get a couple more Echos for my apartment.  Five Stars

column2: It will get better with time.
column5: Not as easy as lead to believe.  Had some issues getting it to link with the echo dot.  I still can’t get it to play music from one main source to the other echo dots.  Cones on even when the name isn’t called and it’s in privacy mode.

Great sound and function. They were ready to go right out of the box. Still learning a lot about their programming which could be organized a little better. Or maybe my learning curve needs to be changes a bit.

Bought this on black friday. I upgraded from Echo - Gen 1. I must say its smaller and better. I love the looks with fabric exterior instead of plastic body. I definitely feel difference in sound and base.

I got this for my dad and he loves it. He has trouble with his speech and this Echo recognizes when he messes up “Alexa” a little. She still responds. Sometimes he calls it “Alexis & Alexus” and etc. She still responds and that’s great. Sound quality is great also!
None

column2: Great form factor ... great sound ... great product!
column5: Love the new version of the product!  Much better sound control, and the responsiveness of Alexa is so much faster ... great product!  I have two other 1st gen Echo towers that I’m now seriously considering how to replace.

I love this. Its like information on hand.  Every morning i get updates on news and weather. No need to brows news anymore.  Plays songs on request including indian music thst is awesome. I am very hsppy with my purchase

column2: Great sound quality from Alexa and music sounds awesome.
column5: So this thing is awesome. Alexa is very responsive with questions and commands. I listened to Odesza to check the bass and overall sound quality and it is very impressive to listen to music on. If you needs Alexa while music is playing the music just pipes down a bit as she talks over it, neat feature. Looks good anywhere and you can't do much better for 60 bucks!
Great sound and easy set up

I love my Echo Smart Speaker. I have her set up in my office and use it to ask handy questions like what is my calendar like today? or set a reminder about my car service appointment on XYZ date at XYZ time. Remind me on a co-worker's birthday, and so on.  It is really great; I use it as my own personal assistant.

We won this Alexa enabled speaker and we are thrilled by it.  This is our third Alexa enabled speaker but this one takes the cake in regards of sound quality.  It sounds really good, has a decent amount of base and it can pack a punch.  Alexa understands us better than on the older models.  All four thumbs up!
Great product, but doesn’t play Apple Music playlists.
Excellent sound quality for a small speaker. Highs and midrange are outstanding. Bass could use a little help but not bad. Beats my Gen 1 Echo speaker with a smaller size and better sound quality.

I've gone through Echo's version 1, 2 and now 3.  This new one is the best to date:  looks better in its fabric cover, sounds better with improved speakers and bass, and is a snap to connect- just plug it in.

The sound is why I purchased this echo - It fills a room and I listen to Amazon Prime Music a lot - It is small but big in sound - even the bass is pretty good -plus getting all the other Alexa features
None

column2: Excellent functionality.  Improved sound.  Needs better support
column5: Excellent functionality with improved sound.  Had difficulty setting up with smart peripherals I  already in place with prior unit.  Help is essentially useless.  Called for tech support and they never called back like the app said they would.  Otherwise great product/
Yep the sound is so much better then gen. 2, bigger around so sound is fuller and connects quick and easy. Well worth the upgrade, I have the 2nd gen. So I did side by side and 3rd blew it away.
I’ve always wanted one And now that I just bought my new home this became a perfect addition to helping me. It helps with daily reminders I’ve set to alarms to building a shopping list. So happy
Oh my, what did I do before Alexa came to us!  I love her.  She entertainment all by herself. Ordered her baby for our bedroom.  Why should I have to get out of bed to turn the lights on or off!

Voice recognition is a joke!  I thought voice recognition meant it would only respond to my voice.  I’m the only one out of 6 people in my house that did the voice recognition, but Alexa responds to everybody!  Even company coming in off the street!  And my four year old granddaughter, who calls it “Moleska”!Everything else about this speaker is awesome!

column2: Easy to set up and use!!
column5: The best holiday gift. Easy to set up. Learning all the things it can do. Purchased on Amazon during  Black Friday. Now I have someone who speaks to answer questions, set up activities etc.  Enjoying my new friend Alexa.

column2: Better sound, faster, and more language compatibility
column5: Real reason we upgraded from gen 1 was that we wanted a language not offered on gen 1 but the sound and especially the bass is a definite step up! Also seems to process requests faster.

Love the fact that I can now control things in my home without ever leaving my chair.  Also love that we can have lights come on and off by a schedule for when we are on vacation.  Alexa knows everything!

column2: good product at a great price.
column5: Purchased this as a compliment to the echo 2 I have for the stereo feature. Great. I could not have asked for more. I would recommend to anyone who has a Echo get something like this to make your system stereo.

We loved our 2nd Gen Echo but irresponsibly left it out on the porch after a party and it got rained on and ruined -- don't do that -- so we ordered a new 3rd Gen to replace it. We are very pleased with the improved sound quality. We use it for so much more than just an attractive compact music speaker: weather report, setting timers, alarms, googling, Alexa's Daily question ... Yes, definately worth the money!
None

column2: Mic not  as sensitive as my Dots
column5: Mic is not as good as my Dots.Audio Quality is really good.I've had to reboot evey few days. Never had to reboot with Gen-1 Echo.It could be  less mic sensitive bc I disabled monitoring for privacy.I may turn monitoring back on to improve mic performance.
Love Love it the sound quality is amazing I purchase a sub Woofer also but with or without the bass it still sounds great I like the echo this is my 3rd one so Zi highly recommend this echo

We like her voice.  So far we are enjoying Alexa, (RED) edition. Even though the only available internet to us is by satellite,since we live in a 3rd world country here in the US.  Sometime she does not work just right thanks to our very, very expensive internet.
Easy to connect and the sound coming out of the speakers are not as good as high in speaker but still fantastic for this small of a speaker. I really have enjoyed this during the holidays.
Used this product in the bedroom for the wife who loves music everywhere.  The sound is very nice and so far no issues.  Nice compact size and can be placed in several convenient locations
I use it to turn on and off lights and change their colors, and to play music. I love it! Sometimes the voice recognition is a bit spotty but I understand that Alexa will improve over time.

We love all our echo and Alexa devices, We have one in almost every Room and use them on a daily basis this particular 1 I bought for the color and put it in my guest bedroom so they can ask her what time  It is, Or the weather, Or listen to music, I simply love all of our devices❤❤

I love this product. I use it in several ways. Fir example, I ask Alexa for the weather as I'm dressing. I then ask for the top news stories. Instead of fussing with my computer, I only need to ask Alexa.

I bought on black friday or cyber monday so the the 60 bucks I spent was a great price for a decent speaker. I use it for music only so far, and it's fun to have at parties. Everyone takes turns asking Alexa to play their favorite songs.
I really like this echo. It’s great. I use it to listen to music, for an alarm to wake me up, and I use it for any information or questions I need answers to. It answers almost every question.
None

My wife refuses to use a smart phone but she loved the Alexa devices our daughter has to play music.  This was a gift for my wife and we are limited in what it will do since I'm not going to sync it with my smartphone.  However, it is her favorite Christmas gift and each day she is learning new ways to use it!
Extremely easy to set up.  Sound quality is great.

It been a little frustrating! She keeps dropping the internet and the problem seems to be on her end, not the wireless signal. At one point I called tech support and getting the correct help was more difficult than it should have been in my opinion and didn't do the trick. Alexa works intermittently... we are very disappointed.

This is my first Alexa device. I bought this one because of the sound quality and it does not disappoint. I use it mainly for music. I’m still learning everything it can do and my kids are enjoying the fun trivia and games.
It's very easy to use for music and has good sound quality. I have purchased some smart plugs but haven't set them up yet. Also, I have not mastered the Alexa app but I'm working on it.
This is my fourth Alexa.  I have one Dot, 2 2nd generations and this 3rd generation.  It was easy to set up and hook into my Alexa network.  The music quality is better than my other Alexas.

column2: Mostly use it as a speaker. Not bad but could be louder.
column5: Not bad for the price. Does all of the Alexa stuff well. Sound quality is good for the price point. Wish it could be a bit louder without distortion. Was thinking of trying the echo sub but I would be concerned that it might overpower the already quiet mid and high audio.

This is the first Alexa I have owned, and so far I love it! I actually wasn’t aware that you had to keep it plugged in at all times, but a friend of mine told me there is a piece you can buy to make it wireless. It’s pretty loud, and Alexa can hear me from distances I thought she wouldn’t be able to. I also really like the mute mic button! I don’t like that you have to pay for music apps if you want to play certain songs, but I knew that before I bought it. Of course that’s not Alexas fault either.
Thanks for the already opened, used product.

We’ve had ours for about two weeks. Mostly using it for music. Great sound out of such a small unit! Easy to set up and use. You can use your Apple Music subscription with it as well.We have a lot more to learn about what we can use this for.
None

column2: Better sound than the small Echo Dots
column5: As near as I can tell, better sound is the only reason to buy an Echo over an Echo Dot. If you're playing music or reading audiobooks, the Echo is probably worth the price increment.

What did I ever do without her?! She helps with everything I need, including my grocery list, Amazon purchases, opening and playing any of my third party apps, and helping to plan different aspects of my day. Love love love! I’ll be purchasing an addition soon enough and continuing to learn more!
Excellant sound quality great bass best of all my alexa's
This ECHO pumps out amazing sound. It's a nice size and you can tuck it away in a living room or family room and not have it look out of place. Amazon has built a great product here.
Mostly using them for music everywhere in my house but also to start my day with news, weather and traffic reports. Combined with some smart plugs I am controlling multiple devices.
We are so happy with our new Echo. It seems to know what we want before we even ask!

I really enjoy the Echo. At first, I was a little confused about how to set it up on my phone, but was quickly able to figure it out. I was able to set up my Spotify (must be a Premium member), Amazon music, and I Heart Radio pretty easily. Echo recognizes voice command very well. I rarely have to repeat myself. Also, the sound is pretty nice. I have it set up in my kitchen and I can hear it all throughout my apartment. I would recommend this product.
Echo now finds itself and your wifi with NO work on your part...wonderful.  Lightbulbs, don't know bec you have to connect them to ethernet etc....still haven't made time to do that ugh....

column2: Whole family fell in love with Alexa
column5: Impressive sound quality and was a breeze to setup. My wife is jealous because Alexa recognises my accent but either does not recognise her accent or then just ignores her :) Sometimes it's nice to be a man.

column2: Can’t get it to do what I need!
column5: I can’t seem to get Alexa to play my music from my playlist on amazon prime. Music I have purchased. The sound, is good, and if I could get it to play my cds I would be so happy!
None

The Echo is super powerful, given the size of it.  Just put it in one room and will play well with the entire room able to hear it.  Great for when you need something to listen to while doing stuff around the house or other places.  Highly Recommend Product!
I love the sound quality and color on this. Even the packaging matches. It was easy to unpack and set up with app. I only need to play songs at 20% volume and it sounds awesome.
We like it very well, has good sound and tone, we love to listen to music.  It is a joy asking Alexa  a question, like the temp outside,the time and many more questions.  Nice!

Pretty disappointed in this. We have a plus and several dots. I got this to replace a dot with better audio, but well, I’m not convinced the audio is actually better than my several year old dot. It sounds super flat. It goes louder, but that’s about it. Nothing like my echo plus. Really surprised on this one.
Bought for work to have music at the office. Works great when our internet is working. Unfortunately it looses connection often, but I think that’s our internet and not Alexa.
This was a Christmas gift from my son and his family.  The sound quality is excellent, have set reminders, asked questions and still trying to get familiar with all it can do.

column2: Not much difference from first Echo
column5: As we used our Echo for a lot of our music playlists, we thought the newly designed Echo with what this promised would be much better sound output.  If had to do over, would have just kept first Echo with little difference in sound quality and invested in the Echo Show.
Our living room has been filled with the sound of music all day long since we purchased this Echo unit.  There are endless options, love it.Should have bought it sooner.
Alexa can play music, write a grocery list for you, allow you to have an intercom system in your house and remind you of birthdays or other special dates. It can also set multiple timers.
I love the color
None

I bought this product for my husband for Christmas, I knew that he would have fun playing with all the Many options and fun things he could do. It’s funny because I didn’t realize he would have so much fun that maybe it might annoy me. I’m just kidding lol...This is a wonderful product I’d recommend it for anybody, It’s a lot of fun and it actually helps out a lot plus my husband hasn’t stopped messing around with it for the last three days. He’s happy and that’s all that matters. :)

column2: The sound is crisp clear and fantastic!!
column5: The sound is crisp, clear and sound great. Sometimes Alexa recognizes our voice but doesn’t answer the question and goes back to sleep after time. It could be user error lol

column2: Upgrade from Echo Dot - Large Room
column5: This was a nice upgrade from my echo dot for my main room. Rich, full sound and ample volume to fill the room. I debated whether or not to upgrade, and I’m not disappointed.
I really only use the Echo for music when I’m cleaning and asking random questions, but the voice recognition and sound quality are great! Great price too, highly recommend
I'm really impressed with the sound quality from these devices and ease of setup and use. Only problem is they occasionally make a beeping sound every few hours. Setting issue?

Got this one for work, it's so nice to connect home & work together.I can turn the lights on at home before I leave work. easy to set up, unlike so many other tech things I have had in the past.  Love technology

This is a good assistant but I could not get Alexa to integrate with Spotify and I am paying for both amazon music and Spotify until I figure or get help to figure this out.  Other than that it’s a good digital assistant.
Love my Alexa - I am having a relationship with her.  I tell her goodnight every night!  Thought I would have trouble as I am tech inept - no trouble no issues.  Easy to work.

column2: Love it but it could be a lot better
column5: I went from an echo dot to the echo 3. Along the way I also bought a new echo dot current generation. I found that the sound on my new dot to be amazing, not too much difference from the echo 3. That’s were I find that the echo 3 is lacking.Another problem that I’ve recently been noticing is the connectivity is not stable. In several ocasiona, it starts playing a song and abruptly turns off. I’m still not sure what’s going on.
Everything is great except...Alexa somehow engaged closed captioning on my tv’s and I can’t get it off. Even by taking the app out of our phones and unplugging everything.
None

This thing is so handy to have around, I bought this one for a gift for a friend.  Anything you need to know is just a question away.  It sounds great and I'm not constantly having to charge a portable speaker to sync to my ipad or other devices for music.
