Absolutely love it. Purchased with echo dot and two smart plugs. Now I can tell my coffee maker to turn on from my bed. Love that Alexa plays music with no commercials or reminds me to call people.

Instant variety of music at my command via voice requests across the room. No turning on stereo equipment, browsing through tapes, records and CD's. Also, requests for information instantly. Although not all my questions have been answered. That is disappointing and going to the library or my computer still does the job. Maybe the Echo data base will eventually expand and those questions will be answered? Otherwise, I'm content for now.

column2: The best time to upgrade old hardware. Now!
column5: I love this version of Alexa. I have the original echo as well. The biggest difference between this echo and the 1st gen is probably voice recognition, its can really pick up voices even while music and or audiobooks are playing. The next best improvement is probably sound quality, the bass of this echo is impressive. I haven't needed to push the volume past 6 for music and 4 for audiobooks. This is a very good gift for the right person. Or even yourself. Highly recommended.
Buggy version.In stereo mode.Each time i use a command, there's a squeal before the music starts every time.The left channel led ring stays on a lot.
The 3rd generation unit has the best sound yet and is very 3 dimensional. Easy to set up and communicate with. Should have bought a couple more for gifts at the time of the deal!
Bought this as a Christmas gift for my brother. He loves it. It works and sounds great and it’s a cool color. I have the dot but will be getting this for myself soon.

column2: Big sound for a little speaker!
column5: Love it!  I upgraded from dot (which now resides in another room) and loving the sound!!!! Omgosh wish is done this long ago!  Very responsive and have had no issues.

column2: Great for loved ones who need some help with memory
column5: I bought his for my mom who is becoming forgetful. I can ask Alexa to remind my mom of doctors appointment and ask it to play music for her anytime ahead of time. It’s great. Great sound.
Great sound quality! I have the first generation Echo and these were much nicer in design and sound quality! Got a great deal during Black Friday. Highly recommended!
None
easy to set up great sound

column2: I wanted to add color and another Alexa in my living room
column5: I wanted to add color to my living room so I purchased another Echo 3 gen. Alexa is great as ever but the color red, I'm not sure it's red it's more a faded full red
Ordered two - based upon family members advice and it was an excellent idea. Two of them make my whole house sound exceptional! Holiday music never sounded so good!
Christmas gift for my daughter and she absolutely loves it.  I didn't realize how many things the Echo does,  now I need to buy another for my other child. :0) great gift..
I have Gen 1 and 2 and so far this one is my favorite. It's not as tall as Gen 1 and a little wider than 2.  It has good sound and works well with voice recognition
Our new Echo 3rd Gen. is a very noticeable upgrade from our Echo Dot. The Echo Dot was adequate but the Echo 3rd gen. is definitely better. A worth while purchase.
The sound is good from the echo

Para mi uso personal, muy bueno un producto de excelente calidad, pero mi recomendación es que deberían tener en youtube un video en español para que expliquen que se puede hacer con Alexa o cuales son las funciones que se le puede pedir por ejemplo yo compré adicional dos Fire Stick y me aparecen en el app de Alexa los dos con mi nombre y no se como aparecieron allí y que puedo hacer con ellos con Alexa, por eso hablo de un video explicativo, o que tiene que ver Alexa con los Fire Stick.
This thing is great I have it on all the time by Christmas music through the holidays and this morning I started out with Hank Thompson where else could you find that

column2: Mighty sound, in a small package. Better than the echo dot.
column5: We got two of these. I should have gotten 4. They pack a lot of sound in the small package. I love that I can use the headphone port in the back for either a line in or line out. I currently have a projector plugged into one and it works perfectly.
None
I am still learning to use this. I like it.

column2: Much improved and easier to use
column5: This new generation of echoes is very intuitive and connects much more quickly. It is also more reliable and does not disconnect repeatedly as past versions did.

column2: Does not work in pulbic wifi network
column5: I had a hard time to get this Echo Gen 3 connected to public wifi, even the technical support could not figure out the problem. My Echo Gen 2 is working just fine. I did the software update but the problem still remains. Sound quality not far superior to generation 2 Echo.
This is an amazing product to have at home.  It does everything I need.  It’s like having my own assistant and the sound quality is great, especially with music!
Working. I had to unplug and restart once because it recognized the request, however no music asked for came out. Unplugged restarted and everything came along correctly.
I have been extremely happy with my Echo and all that it can do.  I am still learning but I am amazed at the capabilities of Alexa.  I can't wait to continue on.
This was an upgrade from gen 1.  The sound is a bit better.  That’s about it.  I also like the shorter speaker.  Gen 1 is still around just exiled to the bathroom.
I love my echo, and I love having Alexa to take care of things as fast as I think of them, like adding things to my shopping list and creating an alarm or timer.

column2: As an ECHO, this is a very popular item.  Great for listening to music.
column5: I like being able to listen to music while cleaning or doing my hobbies.  I  can ask Alexa to play a specific song or genre of music.  This allows me to hear my favorites without having to change the music every other song.  However, every now and then,  Alexa doesn't understand what I am saying.  This can be frustrating.  Luckily, it doesn't happen often.

column2: 3rd generation Echo is a great addition to the home!
column5: The Echo 3rd generation was easy to start up, has great sound and voice recognition. I have not had to use tech support so I can not comment on that. The thing I love the most is the red color, so pretty!
None

This is my first Echo and I loved it! It’s Alexa assistant is amazing and combined with several cheap wifi Bulb adapters from iHaper and one Lifx Mini, I was able to build my Starter Smart Home.I just ordered two small Echo Dots for the other rooms!

column2: Pandora and Amazon music would not work after three weeks
column5: After three weeks it would not play music from Amazon or Pandora. So I returned it. I wanted to order a new one but I never received the 20% off for pre-ordering and the person I talk to said that promotion was no longer available. Since I never received it to begin withI would’ve thought an exception could be made
better than I expected

Gave it to my GF for Christmas.  She was not sure she wanted it.  But after getting home and installing it, she fell in love with it.  Controlling her TV, music, light switches, etc. became the basis of her life!

I did not intend to buy the Echo 3 for myself. It was going to be a Christmas present for someone else, but I found the free trial of Amazon music was linked to my account. I decided to keep it, and I have throughly enjoyed it.  It is so helpful and easy to use.This comes under the category of being something for a person that you think you might like. I did and I use it everyday. Merry Christmas to me!
This was a replacement for a 3rd Gen that made a popping sound after responding to a command. The replacement performs with no popping and we're enjoying it.
I live in an area that radio reception is limited.  My Alexa is just perfect for my needs and keeps me company.  Looking forward to using all of the features.

Very difficult to connect to Spotify premium. It will only work on Bluetooth but then Alexa won’t work. Change default to play Spotify and still playing amazon music. If I ask Alexa to play Spotify, it plays free Spotify, and not premium account. You can’t change Spotify music in the Alexa app, only Amazon music. I purchased google home instead and much more satisfied. This Alexa is a waste of money. Wish I could leave less than one star.
Love the sound,  if you have a medium size living room and you dont have a portable speaker, this echoe is what you need to listen to spotify or amazon music.
Wanted another Echo for my bedroom and this was the current model. Sound is improved from my first one, fits nicely with room decor and was easy to set up.
None
This is my 4th unit and by far, the most frustrating. She just doesn’t listen very well compared to our other ones. The sound is great, no complaints there.
The set-up was a breeze and the sound that comes out is unbelievable. I have bought (4) including mine and have given the others to family members. They love it. 👍🏽👏🏽👌🏽
So far this Alexa has been one of my best investments. It does so much and I have only begun to unlock the potential it has. I’m excited to see what else I can hook up to it.
I recently retired and it’s great to have Alexa help me remember appts and get information, listen to music and get recipes. I just need to work on my integration knowledge

column2: Works almost as well as my previous echo

column2: Smart home? Get Google. Gimmick? Get Echo.
column5: Works great for some smart home products, but not all. Also if you are planning on using these as speakers, don’t. The blue tooth is the absolute worst.

The product is awesome. However, I messed up somehow when I activated it using my Alexa AP. It is seeing three units instead of two, so I can’t get the units to communicate with each other. It keeps telling me one of my Alexa units is offline. My error.....but frustrating.
So far I have enjoyed it.  It’s in my bathroom.  I just ordered the dot as I think it will better served in a different room.  The sound quality is “AMAZING”.

I've actually used my device almost exclusively for music, the feature that attracted me to it.  I really appreciate being able to summon up a group or artist in my mind and almost instantly be listening to his/her/their songs.  Alexa has also answered a few questions about weather, store hours, and such.  She's pretty convenient, I must admit, even though I was reluctant to have her in my home.

column2: Didn't want it but it's fun
column5: I didn't want Alexa -- but my daughters gave it to me for Christmas.  I keep it in my kitchen/family room.  It's nice coming home from work and requesting music - etc... while I'm settling in to make dinner or read a book!
None
I love this Limited addition read on the echo speaker. i’m really big about getting items that are limited or special edition. The red is vibrant and deep.

column2: I wouldn’t recommend this product just yet due to it shutting down frequently.

When it cuts out I ask Alexa to play the radio station again.  My music comes back on and the process is repeated.  I like sound that comes through on the speaker.  My first Alexa only lasted 8 months and the sound was awful.  This 2nd time I bought a better quality Alexa.  Hopefully it will last longer.  Thank you!
I was looking for a rechargeable speaker not one that you had to leave plugged in, it was a nice speaker but just not what I was looking for as a speaker???
3rd gen echo has better base and sound at a higher volume. It’s shorter and wider than gen 2 and has some kind of fabric around it which gives a better look

I have an Echo Dot that I use daily, actually leave on and change stations in morning and night time. I use the Echo much in the same manner as it is located where I stay most of the day, great company!
All I had to do was plug it in and it literally set itself up.  I already had the Echo dots but I wanted a louder speak so that I could listen to my books on tape on room, the sound is awesome.
The sound quality is awesome. I love all the features, way too many to list! This is my second Echo and I am pleased with the product. Highly recommend!

Ever since we brought it , we a having lots n lost of fun with. My kids loves To talk Alexa n ask her educational questions. A great buy. Help me me stay on track with my daily busy routine. We love it n we order three more so yeay.

I am still learning what the Echo offers. I paired it to 3rd party plugs.. Too bad Alexa doesn't have a preferred brand that didn't need to download 3rd party app..but hey it works well...Nest requires you to merge to Google account.. another thing I had to create as well.lots more to learn and setup.
I’m so glad I moved forward with upgrading from Echo 1! Sound quality is superior and fills my room incredibly well. Sound is clearer and the bass in songs sound great. Definitely recommend.
None
Didn’t want it in my house, now we love it!! Convenient, so easy to set up 5 yr old could do it, grouping lights are a piece of cake as is the dot set up, and it’s actually pretty fun to have around!

My only compliant about it but I’m no tech guy is that it constantly has to be plugged in to work but other than that for its size, the loudness and sound quality are really amazing. It’s connects to Bluetooth almost instantly.I haven’t had any issues with it
único que no me trabajo Samsung nokia 8  Pero esta bien me gusta lo puse con la computadora Y pongo todo el día la música cristiana que me gustó
This is my first echo speaker and I’m impressed how good it is i also bought a echo show5 really enjoying them the sound is really good and loud
I like the easy access to music, appliances and plugs (control on/off, timers), and internet, but disappointed with connecting to TV for sound.
Great sound! Still miss the turn-dial volume control of the original Echo. I wanted this to be pairable with the Echo 2 at minimum. Boo. Hiss.
I have two as left and right TV speakers.  They sound much better than the TV speakers.  They fill the room with sound.  Better sound than the echo dot.

This is a handy speaker that has great sound quality. Alexa is very helpful as well and setting up the Amazon smart plug was seamless.  I love listening to amazon music as well. Most of the time Alexa can understand song titles even if you don't quite know the exact name. All in all so far I have had a great experience with this Echo. Oh yeah, the twilight blue is a great color also.
This little number packs so much capability. Plays every song we’ve asked for.  Will tome how long your cookies are baking. Looks up historical data. And tells jokes!
Echo 3rd Gen. is great, great sound, easy set up, easy to use. Looks good in my family room. Better sound than my dots . Smaller than earlier versions.
None
Good upgrade from a dot, does not pick up commands well, 2/5 commands will be wrong. The bass blows the mid tones out, only buy when on sale.
Echo is easy to set up. Echo answers questions immediately and plays songs just by asking.I don't know why I waited so long to get one.

column2: Reliable for waking a person up.
column5: Using this to wake my husband up the days he goes to an Active Day program for dementia patients. I can step out of the picture and let the echo take over.

Sound quality of this device is great compared to second generation. However, device stops streaming music after just a few songs. Then randomly, sometimes hours later, begins playing  again. I called tech support , they were aware of the problem but unable to fix it. Had to unplug the device at night because it again playing music in the dead of night. Hopefully Amazon corrects the problems soon.

column2: Easy setup and has done everything I asked it to do.
column5: Everything seemed to work good with the Echo helping me set up. I still have to look at the tutorial so I can get as much value as I can from it.
There is nothing to not like about this speaker. I had another one that went on the blink and I received this as a Christmas gift and I'm very happy with it so far. No complaints!
Sound quality and voice recognition have improved in the 3rd generation. Music sounds better and responses are more clear than 2nd generation.
We updated our original Echo Dot which we've had for a number of years. Sound was awful. The sound on this new Echo was exactly what I wanted
I have two echo dots and now this it is absolutely amazing it has very good bass and clear sound, I find the speech Recognition very good

column2: Good choice for a good experience.
column5: Love the sound and the fact I can play a lot of music without my CDs. Also I can turn on and off with my voice. Purchased mostly for entertainment.
None
Nice little unit, works as described but sounds so much better than the dots which is what I had been using.  Perfect for playing music while I work, thinking of ordering a second one.

Excellent support! This was a gift for my husband. On Xmas day he had trouble setting it up. He called the support # I was given at purchase. The person solved his problem quickly and pleasantly. We were surprised at the service during the holiday. He loves his gift, uses it to check the weather every day and to listen to music.
Loud enough. Enough bass w/o needing a subwoofer. Clarity is excellent. Running Amazon Music, which is now using FLAC files. Sound great.
I bought to replace an echo dot. This unit cannot hear me from the same distance as the dot and it has more trouble understanding than the dot.
Great with smart lightbulb to turn on lamp. Great with smart plug to turn on other things. Fun family games and nice speaker for music.

column2: So easy, even my granny can do it
column5: Got this for my 89 year old grandma for Christmas and she loves it. After giving her a list of common things to do, she was quickly able to figure out how to get her favorite music, news, weather, drop in to other Alexas in the house, etc...the family has been using it to stream music and play games.
Great buy, our second echo and love its functionality and all around features only issu is integration with other products which can be improved
We bought two of these along with the subwoofer and are amazed at the big sound from these little guys. Very happy with this purchase.

column2: Better Than I Could Have Hoped!
column5: Absolutely amazing! Alexa is sooo useful, for a while I had been wanting her but when I finally obtained an Echo it came with more features than I ever imagined. I use Alexa every day; her usefulness knows no limits!! :DAlso I got the Red version, and the color is beautiful!
I have the Echo Dot and wanted to upgrade it. The Echo Dot is definitely smarter. Perhaps I have a defective unit but I am returning it
None
Love it.  I use it for music, timers and shopping lists.  Works the best.  I am sure I have just scratched the surface of her potential.
Easy set up and outstanding sound quality compared to the older versions. While it may not be a big deal for some, the newer generation units are much better looking too.
Sound quality is where is this unit shines— much better than the previous echo versions, which I actually really liked!  Better than most Bluetooth units on the market, just not as portable...
Limited music player interface. It's not very good that it's only limited to certain music streaming apps.  Would love to use YouTube music for more specific music listening choices.
Still learning, but I liked it enough to purchase the dot.  Now my kid can listen to her music in her room and I can listen to mine .
Set up is painfully easy!!  😊  Audio quality is very nice, and basic equalizer functions can be "ordered" verbally, and it responds.  It looks nice and just works.  We like it!
Better than 2nd Gen. Great Bass awsome sound. Paired with fire stick for sound, highly recommend using for movies and sports. Volume 3 is loud, volume 6 is really loud. Love the speaker.

Our first generation Echo had an option to adjust the volume by turning the top, the third generation does not. However, the sound quality is much better and the volume control buttons on top work just fine and the voice command can be used without manually controlling the adjustment.
I love the Alexa Echo.. I also have the Dot .. The sound on the Echo is fantastic
Impressive improvement over Gen2
None

column2: Much better sound than the echo dot.
column5: Even if you have a stereo on one room, this is a great speaker to listen to music in the other room. Much better than the echo dot.
I was very pleasantly surprised at the good sound quality. I’m definitely purchasing another and the sub-woofer for great 2.1 sound.

column2: Great sound for a small speaker

Purchased this to replace my 1st gen echo that just stopped connecting to my internet after several years of use. It's super handy!

column2: You have to repeat it two or three times ..
column5: You have to keep telling what you want Twice or three times before it’ does it is annoying. But when the musics plays sounds excellent but deal breaker you have To repeatedly say it again 🙄
This is a really nice upgrade to the echo dot that we had. Still does all the normal things but with a much better sound system.
Great integration, very pleased with sound quality compared to my 1st gen.  Pics up my voice from around the corner very easily.

My wife had the 1st one when it came out. Wow what a difference from the 1st 1 to this 1 she loves everything about it in the sound quality is actually amazing. She has 70% of our lights control by Alexa including plugs as well and NO hub required

I previously purchased two Echo Dots and wanted to give the Echo a try. Everything was fine, great sound and look. But it completely died after one week. The power supply was just fine (18v), but no lights/response and it was also plugged into a surge protector. Amazon support was awesome to work with. It has been returned and new one has been shipped. I wonder if I just got a lemon?

column2: Can be use as set. Left and right  love it
column5: Sounds are real good. I bought 2 of these and make them as one pair left and right,  works perfect and sound so good in my store.
None

Honestly, the best speaker I've ever purchased.Bought it on Black Friday and it has been amazing."Alexa, set an alarm for 8AM""Alexa, play _ on Spotify""Alexa, turn on TV" (after I've linked it to my Samsung TV)It has very clear sound quality and doesn't sound mumbled when volume is maxed. Looking forward to buying the smart lights, items to sync her with the entire house.
We love our Alexa Echo's. They are amazing!  They work well, they sound great and we are impressed with how easy they were to set up!

I purchased the unit for my Husband as a Christmas gift. It was very easy to set up once we got it connected to the internet. Had some problems with that but I think it is our network, not the unit. Speaker is nice, Alexa responds well even from other rooms. It has made a very nice addition to the house!
Got this for myself on cyber Monday for $50 bucks and I received it today. Wow what an amazing sound. I love it! The music sounds great.

column2: Great speaker with the great price
column5: Just got it recently, I've been using the 1st generation echo before and I was very satisfied with it. However, Amazon allows you to return the former echo for a gift card. So, I turned the former one back (getting $25 gift card) and get this new echo for only $60. The sound quality is great. Pairing is very easy as usual. For the price, this is more than what I expect. Good looking and great sound!

I never knew it could be so fun!!! Did you know you can play music (like super annoying music) while you aren't home... but your boyfriend is. oh man good times!on a real note, the sound is awesome! I love it!!
This is a fun little speaker. Packs a great sound as well as all of the Alexa "skills". It has the ever important "mute" button.
This is certainly fun to have in your home, I am enjoying everyday  I have only positive things to say about this product Who doesn't love Alexia!!!

I like the fact that I can shut the microphone off at anytime. I have used it to find out the temp outside, when is sunrise & sunset  & answer questions so I don’t have to go online to goggle to get answer. Used it to play music & just love it!

The sound on Echos just keeps improving. I am still delighted after a year and a half with my collection, which is finally complete now for every-room coverage. They still have trouble "dropping out" occasionally after an hour or two of play, but that's usually remedied by simply repeating instructions. Hopefully software updates will continue to improve performance in that area.
None

Everything amazon puts its name on is quality. What more can I say! I run my lights with it, runs my fire stick, and can ask any question and get an immediate response. Sound quality is excellent. Never disappointed.
We are still getting used to having Alexa in the house.  I like it.  The Echo seemed like the best choice, I still think so.
better sound then last gen, like that its smaller, picks my voice up well, love it, i have multiple echos. and def recommend

I’m very impressed with this gizmo. At the age of 70, I am not a Techie but I was able to install and set it up with no problem. It’s fun to talk to, and the sound quality is very good. Thinking of buying another for a gift.
This thing sounds amazing and set up is extremely easy.  Alex nice to ask for news, weather, music etc......not portable...WTF....

column2: Good at what it can do but is lacking in areas
column5: Just wish I would have gotten the google version of this...Alexa is good at what she does but If you’re trying to get one of these things as a way of asking for answers to questions that you have it is pretty much useless...

I ask alexa if she knew how many mins put someone on to cook for my alexa claim she didnt know but my friend  had me on speaker and her alexa told me. That sooo funnny! I told my Alexa now why you couldnt tell me why yo twin sister had tell me through phone LOL
Love the stero sound with music. Don’t like the fact that it’s listening all the time. Enjoying it more then I though I would.

Great- mostly used for music.They should have a lock as I have a 4 and 6 year old and they don’t stop with asking Alexa things...maybe a better voice recognition to only identify my voice- I don’t know what would work best. I currently changed the prompt name from Alexa to one of the choices - seems to work now bit my 6yo is catching on.
None
Very good sounding speaker.  Fills up a room.  Not gonna blow your socks off. But works great.  Have two of them.  Love em

column2: Phenomenal Device, ya gota love technology.
column5: Super easy to pair with my router a fun to use.I don't have music channels on my TV and listening to my iTunes play list gets old. Alexa will play what I ask even if I don't know the whole name of the piece or album. I check on the weather, get headlines and just about anything I need to know.My only regret is that I should have had one long ago.

We have an original large Echo, an Echo Dot, a second generation Echo, and now this one.  The sound quality on this one is the best of them all, even better than the large original Echo.  I would recommend this to anyone.
This gen 3 has much better voice recognition vs. gen 2.  Sound quality is also much better.  Definitely a worthy upgrade!

column2: Echo sounds good for the price. Fun to play with, “Alexa, what’s the meaning of life...etc.”
column5: Our first Alexa thingy. Still getting used to yelling out song requests. Fun. Appreciate the good Speaker quality for the price. Pretty cool. Works great.
I installed two to make quick and easy stereo speakers for TV. They sound great and I also added a sub for awesome bass.

column2: Fun and useful to use. Good to automate with voice control over light and TV.
column5: Like the Alexa economy system. It was the Alexa get me into the smart home system. I have a echo and a echo dot 3rd generation. A fire TV 4K. And soon I will automate most of the light to smart light and integrated with Alexa. My family and I like the Alexa to play music, set timer.
I have 3 Amazon echo's for different parts of my home & I love them, however, the sound quality is not as good as I would like.  You get what you pay for is a good thing to remember!!
Music or talk radio primarily with weather reports around the US. We have an Echo in our bathroom for the same purpose.

I bought Echo on a 5 month payment plan at regular price 2 weeks before Black Friday.  Unfortunately Amazon would not give me the sales price adjustment even though I still owed 4 months on plan.I wasn't offered any work arounds to take advantage of 40% off sale.  Too much trouble to return and re-purchase.  Disappointed but Echo is a fine product.
None

column2: Perfect for the disabled, disadvantaged, and injured person!
column5: My husband is only 49 and had a fall at work shortly before Thanksgiving which caused a subarachnoid brain bleed. I bought several in order to place them around the house to allow me to check on him via my phone thru the echo devices using drop in features and linked them to home devices making it easier for him to control. They have worked fabulously for these reasons as well as the popular features often seen in commercials.
Very easy to set up and to use. Amazon makes sure you know all of the possibilities for using your Echo. I now can listen to my siriusxm on the echo...

I received this as a gift and just love it.  It was easy to install (my grandson said so)and super simple to use.  I use it to play music (that's free if you're a Prime member), get weather reports and get info.  The best gift I've ever gotten was my first Kindle but my Echo is a close second.

I love having Alexa around to turn my home into a smart home.  It allows me to turn on lights, listen to music, get news updates, access my calendar and so much more.  I plan to expand and get some echo dots too.The sound quality is very crisp.

I like it only thing is when I tell it to play music from Apple Music it says i need to link it even though it says in the ap that I am linked to Apple Music. Other than that i like it! Gets loud for how small it is.

column2: Alexa is always available for serious or fun conversation
column5: Alexa plays my favorite music and answers my questions with a pleasant, personality filled voiceHer jokes can make me laugh out loud.

column2: Decent sound quality. Wish it was wireless
column5: Sound quality isn’t as good as I was expecting. Still gets very loud and Alexa is pretty helpful. Was a solid purchase
My husband was very happy we got this. I like that it integrates easily with the Dots. Great sound quality & skills.

I ordered the twilight blue thinking it would look like the picture. Wrong. It's more like a dull pale demin color and not the pretty blue as indicated in the picture.  I would have chosen the gray if I knew the blue was going to look so bland.
We love Alexa.  Every day we use it to listen to JW.ORG readings and music, Spotify music and with our Ring device.
None

column2: Color is not as blue as pictured
column5: I got the Echo to have music in my sewing room, and it’s working quite well.  I was a little disappointed that the “blue” really looks gray in most lights.
I bought it solely to have another Echo for a different room.  I wouldn't know the difference between the 2nd generation and the 3rd.  I'm as satisfied with it as I am my 2nd generation Echo.

column2: Replaced 2nd gen with this one - much nicer
column5: Was happy with the 2nd Gen, but needed to add another.  I feel the improvement in sound quality is very noticable.
Sometimes is aggravating but at the end I’m so happy with, sound quality is good for small spaces, just got my echo studio and together omg, amazing sound
Enjoy having Alexa play music and provide infirmation, often with humor; also like having the plug to turn on a light when entering a dark room.
The color is great and the voice recognition is excellent.  The sound quality is clear and the speakers are better.
We have several of the Gen 2 in service.  The most pronounced feature of this unit is the robust sound.  Excellent.
The sound quality was improved over my original one.  The coloring makes it less visible.  Installation was easy.
It took me a long time to join the ‘smart’ home movement but I’m so glad I did. Having lots of fun getting to know Alexis and all she can do.

Somewhat disappointed.  The voice recognition isn’t as good as my original Echo.  I know, I know:  lots of people said that in the reviews, but...sigh.  Consequently, I kept my original Echo, along with this one.
None
I upgraded my old echo gen 1 to this new echo 3rd gen because of the sound quality and I’m happy with my decision.
Just bought the echo 3rd gen and its a big improvement over the echo dot 2nd gen that I had. Better overall sound and looks.Buy it!
This little speaker has the best sound of my 3 Amazon Echos. It has deeper bass. I can play music throughout my home.

This was a gift for my husband who is visually impaired.  He particularly wanted to be able to ask for favorite radio stations.  He is very pleased with his ability to do that, and with the quality of the sound.
Purchased for my wife at Christmas and she's now talking about adding additional capabilities in our house.  Easy to set up.
The 3rd gen has a much better microphone for voice recognition. The sound quality has also been greatly improved

I was debating getting another Alexa. I outfitted my home with Google home. While google worked it was slow and sometimes unresponsive. Alexa was always on point with great sound. When the product (red) line was released I hade no doubt I was replacing google home with the new echo red. I love it so much better. I only wish the echo dot was also in product (Red).

Used this Echo along with the Echo Dots and Echo Plus to setup a sound sys. in my house, played Christmas music in all room "at the same time", LOVE IT. Sure beats installing speakers and costly sound systems. Great sound. Also purchased the "Ring" door bell. Love it, don't know why I waited so long.

This 3rd gen is an improvement over my 1st gen Echo in terms of sound quality, but is still behind a bit compared to my HomePods in my gym. The microphones in this gen seems to respond a lot better over previous especially when you ask for a command while audio is currently playing. Overall improvement in my opinion.

Expected a little more sound quality. Echo does not hear my commands often... and keeps responding to a wrong command at times... eh...  I know it's a work in progress... but it does well for  what it is. I'm satisfied.
None
I was resistant to get a device that listens to me.  Not anymore.  Alexa takes notes, puts things on grocery lists and so much more.  I'm having a great time getting to know Alexa.

Very good bass, mid and treble are clear and are comfortable to listen. You need to download an app. But it is easy to set up. I bought it on Black Friday at a discounted price. Very good value for the money. Highly recommended.
The sound on this one is a LOT better than the old one.  Traded a first gen in for this one and am glad I did!!
Best thing I’ve discovered. I have two of these and an Echo dot. Exceeds my expectations for this price point.

column2: Mine doesn’t work very well at all.

This thing sounds awesome..she tells me weather..store hours..has great sound quality and she confirms whos right or wrong in my household debates lol

It’s better than the original one I had, the first generation. However, I don’t think that it’s come so far that it’s worth a 5 star rating

column2: as described.  kinda clunky. sounds are ok

column2: Music cuts out all the time
column5: If you are using multiple echos , dots in your home they are not reliable.  The sound is great when they work but units stop playing constantly.  Theses issues are reported all over help forums with no solution that solves it.

column2: Suppose to be better then the 1st generation
column5: Don't have rechargeable battery. And the firs alexa generation had. So bad

I purchased this product and absolutely love it! It has a great voice recognition and sound quality. I love being able to listen to music from either my phone or amazon music. I will certainly buy this item for a family member in the future!

Already highly satisfied with the Echo line of products I was curious to see if in fact it would be improved. Yes, is the answer!. The sound is improved and the voice recognition is more seamless. Replaced gen 1 Echo. Greatly improved sound quality with better voice recognition when playing music loud.

column2: It wasnt hard tio set up

It’s great to have it work with Apple Music and the software has greatly improved. I find I listen to a lot more music because the quality is so good.

Works great with Apple Music. Sound Quality is great at mid range, but if you turn the volume higher it almost sounds as if the speakers a ripping. Its great for apartments but if you wanna add it to a big house its not worth it. Great design.
I love these amazon products. I have one in every room. My entire family loves the convenience of Alexa.

Not good at really anything. Always says alexa is learning and she does not understand. If you just want time date n music shes good but most everything else she dont understand or u have to be really specific n exact. People dont talk like that usually

column2: What a great info filled companion Alexa is!!!

None
Got the speaker for Black Friday for a good price. I use it to listen to prime music, tune in, and Sirius xm and it does a good job with those services. Would definitely buy another one

I always want get speaker so I don’t put my headphone in my phone because it hurt my ears sometimes. But speaker is so CHAMP ever! I swear. I can listen music while I work on my book or clean the house. But I’m deaf tho 🤷🏾‍♀️

column2: I never thought I would want an Echo

second one. shorts out, cuts out, sometimes does not work at all. great sound when working. going to try dot.

I’m bought in with Alexa. I’m just ordering anything Alexa now. If it has a Alexa logo, I’m buying it!

column2: How easy it is to setup

Love love love this new blue color!!! The big echo has a much better sound quality as well as responsive time compared to the echo dot.

Only downside is sometimes she likes to talk over me when I tell her to stop xD like VERY LOUD over me. I dunno if it’s a feature but she’ll randomly increase volume, maybe my roommates have been telling her to be louder without my knowledge. Anyways it’s a great buy.

column2: the alexa echo just keeps getting better and better

I bought one for each of my kids for Christmas. They all love it. They listen to their music, use it as an alarm. Great quality.
I now have a six speaker setup and it’s like going to a rock concert every time I put music on.

I like the varies options it has as far as playing different music. Still trying to understand Alexa’s full capabilities because I know it could do more than what I’m using it for right now. Stay tuned!
Bought for the living room area. Attractive and effective. Voice recognition is on point. And the speaker is pretty impressive.

I don't like that it requires location information to be installed but besides that it is nice.

Sound is better quality than my Bose wave. Had the Echo first generation. This is no comparison. It’s like your grandmother keeping the old 21” tube television rather than upgrading to a 50” flat screen. Very satisfied.
None
Great product. Love its functionality.Guard Home option is great, even if you have an alarm at home, and cameras.I do recommend this product for others to buy.

Alexa cannot find any of Beethoven's five piano concertos. I subscribed to Music Unlimited but Alexa does not tell me when the music I ask for comes from Amazon Music or Music Unlimited so I cannot determine if what I am paying for is worth the price.

column2: Does what is says on the tin

Very good product...I uses echo dot before made this echo even more outstanding....my opinion thz

Voice recognition is unreal... Sound quality is great... still learning everything that smart speaker and Alexa is capable of.

music sound much better than the echo dots. Easy to set up. Was a great Christmas Present.

column2: Great product, and works just as advertised. Getting the hub so it will connect to everything.

column2: Knowing Echo speaker and it's features
column5: What even more kooleer is if you have more than one Alexa echo speaker you can pair them all , create a group for an entire home entertainment audio system. One in the living room, one in the bedroom, one in office room etc. Then apps like Spotify will be able to see the group as and audio output , allow music all over the home. Try it.
Now she is in another part of the house---busy woman!  Great to have music of our choice.
Changed from echo dot and the transition was quick and easy. The sound quality is incredible. Already we love it.

I bought the third gen to replace my second gen. The sound is much better, a little shorter and rounder at the top. I bought two additional as gifts. I think the third gen hears me from a greater distance. Since I was replacing the second gen all I had to do was plug it in and it set itself up.  Happy with my purchase!

column2: Trade in offer is a scam
column5: Participated in the trade in offer and sent in a perfect working condition echo.  I later get an email saying it is rejected and I will be charged the $25 offered with no real explanation and no help from customer service.  Please be aware if you participate in this chances are they will reject yours and charge you more.  Just hoping i get back mine and it still works.
Love this Gen3 Alexa, it was an upgrade for me from Gen1.  Can find zero faults - love it
The Gen 3 is a little larger in diameter than the previous Echos allowing for a little extra Bass response.
We love our Echo and have been using it a lot.  Love the sound of the music and the choices we get.  The whole experience is great.
I love it the sound is excellent only problem I have is it's not portable you have to keep it plugged in for it to play

column2: Where have you been all my life

The Echo has come in very handy for so many things for sports scores, weather, recipe and just playing music.  We have the Echo in the kitchen which is very convenient and it really doesn't take up too much counter space.  It was also very easy to setup.
Not super sound sensitive. Was cumbersome to link to LG UHD Tv.Not as unique as used to be. Needs to universally link to all wireless accessories. Not just proprietary ones.

This is my second echo in this new version I feel the quality of the sound it's better.

It’s an Echo.  Works great. Replaced one I already had. Can’t live out this Household helper.

column2: Connects easily to internet and works as advertised.

The latest version of the Echo (3rd generation) is a very nice step in the right direction - smaller with a much nicer finish and no loss in sound quality.

Ever since I saw the VERY first Echo devices made I thought that these smart home devices were awesome. Now that I have my own, it’s everything I could have asked for. None
I have two of the older model echo dots and love those, but wanted something with better sound. The echo is definitely worth the money! it sounds great and looks great as well.

Alexa seems kind of boring at least my kids think so. But she does what you ask. Except now, even though I haven't had it very long, it seems to be getting slow.
Got our first Echo at Christmas and have purchased several more along with lights. Big hit!

This new version has SO much improved voice recognition in noisy environments.  Truly amazing how it can pick up the wake word no matter what is going on.

column2: Sound quality is great. Worth the price.
column5: I received this as a gift. This product is amazing. I love to listen to music on my sound bar, but I must say the sound quality on this device is really good so much I use it daily now. Another thing I really love is that I can be pretty far away from it and it responds to command quickly and is very accurate. Definitely looking into buying more products like this!
Very helpful when you ask questions. Hopefully,  later you can carry on a conversation.

Always thought about getting this but now that I have been adding smart home devices I love have a single app that can run all devices.  My echo turns lights on and off, change colors, etc even though they are from different vendors.  I love being able to turn the microphone off too.

Love it.  Sound quality is superb.  It replaced a Google home device.  Very pleased.

Really like my echo 3rd Generation smart speakerIt says that it does not support Bluetooth However It Does support Bluetooth because I am able to pair it with my phone and play music from my phone on it. column2: Probably not the best but definitely good.

None

I bought this one to play music and it has really nice speakers and sounds good.

column2: Worst alexa device I have bought
column5: I already have four Alexas; one previous generation and three dots scattered all over my house. The 2nd generation dots are really nice, and so I thought I'd go with the better sound and latest upgrade for Alexa. The setup was absolutely a dream, and she was up and running in no time. Really liked the better sound, too. But then all of a sudden we began to notice she was just getting too chatty, always asking us if we wanted to do this thing or that thing and THEN...she began asking us if we wanted to be referred to other things to buy! REALLY? I finally found a place in the Alexa app to make her less chatty, but then we noticed that there was a random "Bloop", or "Bloop-bloop." sound just out of the blue until it was driving us nuts. Not all that often, but way more often than we could stand. Then, the final straw. I have my four alexa devices scattered throughout my house and in a group, so I can just tell Alexa to play some music on all the devices and I'll have music throughout the house. Well, she suddenly just took it upon herself to drop right out of the group! Suddenly, when I told her to play music throughout the house, she would do so, but only on the Alexas that weren't in the main room. THAT'S IT!  I packaged her up and sent her back and wrote this review. I really only want her to answer the questions I ask and not embellish and give me a life history or ask me if I want to go other places. I'm glad I still have my old Alexa. I hooked her back up again and while she may not sound quite as good, she's a lot easier to live with, AND she works, too.

column2: Echo records EVERYTHING you say in range and stores if on the Amazon cloud.
column5: We were early adopters of the Echo device.  We had multiple setup around our house.  Until one day, the device in our living room started playing back previously recorded conversations my wife and I had.  The Echo was not being used when it started playing back our conversations and the conversations that it recorded happened when we were NOT using the device.We removed them all and stopped paying for Amazon Prime music.

column2: Brief mode doesn't work and it sometimes responds to words that aren't Alexa
column5: As Amazon added new features, they gradually got to the point where they decided to make the Echo You're folksy companion rather than a machine for automation and hands-free work. I turned on brief mode because I don't want a 5-minute conversation when I'm just trying to check the weather or turn on the lights. It didn't work. I still get it to tell me to have a nice day instead of the basic tone it's supposed to play, and sometimes it tries to tell me about new features I don't need when I just want it to read the weather.Sometimes I find it listening after picking up on a word like Election.  This is especially annoying when I'm having a conversation and it chimes in about how it came help me with that.I have both Google and Amazon devices, but I'll be replacing the Amazon ones this year because of the broken features.Update: An Amazon representative contacted me and we spoke about the issues I've experienced. He mentioned that one of them could be resolved by a setting in the app, so it should no longer try to tell me about new features.  I'm actually only updating my review to say that a TV show said "sure," and the Echo just responded to the TV to tell it about Sure brand deodorant. I've unplugged the Echo for now.  We call this a "time out."
None of these contraptions are worth a dam.  Turns on when I don’t want it to.  Won’t obey commands 90% of the time.  Great invention jut hope someone figures it out someday. Bezos builds garbage!

column2: Next Generation Alexa looks and works great
column5: I purchased this A-Lady for my daughter as a gift.  I have a first-generation model. This one looks a bit more modern and works just fine.  The price is lower (Black Friday had a nice discount) and the unit is a bit smaller than the first-generation. I've come to rely on her for timers while cooking, reminders for every day stuff, alarms for those times I need to set a non-standard alarm (catch a plane for example), etc.  I love the lists  I have one for Walmart, groceries, Costco, Sams Club. It makes shopping so much easier to just be able to add X to the grocery list right when you run out.  A must-have to turn on lights in the house. Great to ask "How old is Actor X" when you see them in a movie.  The A-Lady has become an important part of the family - glad to be sharing the experience with my daughters.

column2: Line -In (Aux) does not work yet remains a feature in the description
column5: I purchased this Gen 3 speaker yeaterday. I have two others, the Tap and the Original Echo that I am generally pleased with. The Gen 3 was for a special purpose, I needed to connect a wired Audio source to it. After checking the specifications, I see it has a Line-In. Actually, its a Line-In / Line-Out connection configurable in software or supposed to be.After setting up, I proceeded to connect the Line-In (Aux) and opened the Alexa app on my iPhone. I found the Line-In/Line-Out switch and changed it to Line-In. At this point, the app crashed and said something went wrong. It would just refresh the screen not allowing you to toggle the Aux to Line-In. After reading some old reviews, I learned about a problem with the iOS app. So, I had an Android tablet around, I opened the Alexa app on it and found the Line-In switch. Again, I activate it. The app did not crash this time but no audio came out.I contacted Amazon device support who franly did not know what Line-In or Aux was. After 10 minutes of wasted time on chat, the CS person came back with "That device does not support Line-IN". I refered him to the current listing which lists Line-In as a feature.The device was returned to the store as Faulty. Today, I purchased an Awsome Ears Boom 2LE from a local brick and mortar store and WOW, what a device. A smart app that works, Line-In that works, sound that is far better than the current echo's, and a useful equalizer to customize the speakers tonal quality. $60.
None

column2: If I was a billionaire, I'd buy the whole world other home speaker products.
column5: I can't know what you want this product for, but if you're like me and many of my friends, having it play music (supposedly of your choosing) is a big deal for you. And in that respect, it sucks. I've had more arguments with Alexa about what music it is I'm trying to listen to than I ever imagined possible. And then when it finally (if ever) gets to the type of playlist I'm looking for, the playlist gets so repetitive after a few listens I can predict the songs coming up. It honestly got so bad I pulled out my old 3-CD changer stereo and hooked that up for listening to music while I get ready for work in the morning. You can't tell Alexa to not play certain songs or bands, nor can you go into your Amazon account to request the same (a feature that seems easy to implement, but Amazon certainly hasn't since I mentioned it to them over a year ago). The only credit I can give the echo is it has decent sound, but considering it's lack of functionality and poor AI, I'll stick with an old school home stereo and a music service through my phone.

I am overall satisfied with my Echo and recently bought a new on for my parents who speak spanish mainly.  Multilingual mode which is mentioned in below user guide for alexsa is not working properly.whether i select English/Espanol or Espanol/English, alex only understands english commands.  she wont recognize my spanish commands.is Espanol only mode, she does recognize both spanish and english commands, but all of her responses are in spanish.there is no way to get her to respond in english to an english command, and spanish to a spanish command which is clearly stated on the amazon website (link below)i tried calling for support twice, and twice the rep wasnt aware of this feature, and once i showed them the website with the feature clearly described, they somehow magically got disconnected and i lost my support.for the bad customer support experience, i am leaving only 3 stars.https://www.amazon.com/b/ref=aeg_lp_sc_d/ref=s9_acss_bw_cg_aeglp_6a1_w?node=17978647011&pf_rd_m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&pf_rd_s=merchandised-search-4&pf_rd_r=TB3Q8ZRP1D3WSCXKAJGD&pf_rd_t=101&pf_rd_p=854092b7-c46b-4f6c-ba7e-7b6e17552e7c&pf_rd_i=17934671011

column2: I do not like that everything you say to the device is recorded.
column5: I personally did not like the fact that everything I said was recorded. Even when it wasn’t supposed to be and I was not speaking to it. The app that I downloaded on my phone showed an allowed me to listen to what was recorded and there were several recordings where I was not talking to the device. The sound quality was good whenever I play music, but I just think it is 100% important for people to have this device to realize that nothing should be said that you would not say in front of the world. If you don’t have a problem with that then I suggest you get this product. I have to say that it is really cool to be able to turn on and off your lights and other appliances with this device. So it’s really up to the individual and how much privacy they would like to have.

The echo is an impressive speaker. Sound is incredible for such a tiny speaker at that price. I would give 6 stars for that.However there are so many things making the Alexa echo annoying, that should be fixed:- the voice recognition is awful when you are used to Google- Most of the time say something, Alexa will answer "I don't know". It is faster to use the thermostat app to set the AC than to talk to Alexa- Playing music from the app is a nightmare (it only works through the desktop alexa website) and you need a paid service to play the music you want- The stereo sound does not work in bluetooth- There should be more Alexa integration in IFTT You cannot control Alexa as a Then clause

column2: Works Ok but constantly telling me that it is playing from _insert ridiculously long device name_
column5: I got mine free from Verizon for signing up with Fios and immediately turned off the mic.  The Speaker is fine for what it is and I use it for music and movies and youtube at my desk.  But it periodically yells out "Now Playing from Gg38elskugoksldkfs;odivfsdf" or some odd string of characters and it's always jarring and often times scares the hell out of me.  Sometimes I hear it making that same announcement from the other room when I'm not even using it.  It would be great if they could create a setting that replaces this and all vocal response with a simple series of light flashes.  Ultimately I like this little speaker but this random yelling out issue has got me close to unplugging it.  I just turned on Brief Mode under vocal responses to see if that helps.  "Alexa, please speak only when spoken to".

column2: Great sound and neat features. But...
column5: I really like the echo 3rd. Gen. I’ve never really owned a smart speaker before.  I mainly use mine for music now and then but I do have a big gripe about it. Not so much the device but the amazon music service really sucks imo for a big reason. Now originally I just had this echo and signed up for amazon music unlimited, and for a while it was fantastic ! A few months later I got my hands on a new amazon tap speaker thinking it would be really great to have a speaker play at each side of my room for a more stereo sound. I synced up my new tap to my account , made a speaker group for both devices , requested a song to play and was greeted with “sorry to play this song on this group of speakers you need to upgrade your music plan” Wait what?! In order for me to use more than one speaker in my one room I need to pay more money? I looked up more info and sure enough yah , you need to pay more money to have the SAME song play one MORE THAN ONE device. Kinda bull shyt  if you ask me. Well just keep that in mind if you plan on buying more than one for expanded sound. That said , some songs play on both with no problem and other times it says I need to pay for an up grade. Buyer beware.

This and all echo products are incapable of playing music for more than 15 consecutive minutes. I have tried on multiple devices, streaming services, updates, reboots and contacts with Amazon support. Music will play but stop altogether after an arbitrary time, no more than 15 minutes.

column2: Good product and amazing customer service
column5: Had a difficult time setting up 4 speakers together. I did everything right just had a glitch I guess. After a little effort Amazon reached out and took care of the problem. Their customer service lady Kristina was amazing. She was the second person I talked to.. The first wasn't so helpful.The problem is fixed and Kristina really made me feel at ease and reassured me she'd fix the problem at all costs, the entire time. It says a lot about Amazon. I couldn't have talked to a better person to help solve the problem. Good job Amazon! Give her a promotion!The product is great too. Once connected it works flawlessly. Hopefully you don't run into the same problem I did, but if you do rest assured Amazon will do whatever it takes to solve it.Where else can you get that? Not many places. Thanks Kristina and thanks Amazon!

column2: Amazon can't even make it pair with a phone!
column5: I gave my mom an Echo and I just wanted to pair with it to play Christmas music and when I try to pair Amazon's incompetent designers want to force me to use the app and then, apparently, take the device from my mom's account and add it to mine! All I want to do is pair my phone to her Echo and play some music. EVERY other bluetooth speaker manufacturer seems to understand that. Don't waste your money on this thing. Even trying to play music over Amazon Music can be painful thanks to the problematic speech recognition - it's pretty good for basic use, but for album and song titles it's extremely flaky. It normally defaults to playing the title track of an album rather than the entire album, for instance.Unfortunately Amazon won't allow me to submit a review with no stars whatsoever.

column2: If you play Amazon music you’ll be paying a lot more to play it on a gen3.
column5: I used my older Echo to listen to Amazon music.  After I bought the gen 3, I found I couldn’t play songs on it with my current plan which cost $3.99 a month.  If I wanted to use the gen3 , the cost per month would triple. Even though I called the Amazon help line, no one told me I would have to pay triple the money to play Amazon music.  I decided to pay the extra because the sound is very good, but after three days, the gen3 stopped working.  My older one is still working.  I’m returning the gen3, and going back to the older one.  I think I’ll save my money.

Sound is nice and clear but it is not as amazing as some people or reviews say. Sound quality it's not its best feature.Looks nice, sounds good.Some issues with Spotify (funny thing no issues with Amazon Music).My kid loves it and my wife loves it too (after some resistance at first).For the price is excellent considering you get an AI device.

I received my Echo as a Christmas present last year (2018)>  it's been an OK thing to have in the house.  But in the last couple of weeks, when I asked for music to be played from MY Music, the streaming was interrupted with ads.  WTH!  This may end my use of these devices.  Doesn't Amazon make enough $$$?  If I'm listening to a symphony, or sacred music to be played while I meditate or pray, advertising totally inappropriate.  Let the buyer beware.

Isn't that great?Better yet, just mentioning fertility, birth control, or the word "baby" will allow Amazon to announce to the world that you are pregnant, even if you did want to keep that from your current baby's baby daddy.

I cant seem to get Alexa to do anything but play music, and even then the system likes to at the least convient time switch from spotify to amazpn music if your wording isnt perfect. Keep an eye on these smart homes, if this was a person they would be boarding the short bus to go a nice soft padded room for the rest of time.

Absolutely love this Echo. Sound is awesome. Alexa features are great and useful. Highly recommend! I loved it so much I bought more for Christmas gifts. I am so impressed that I plan on buying one for each room of the house!!!

column5: False advertising. This is clearly listed as the All New Echo 3rd Gen $59.99 But when you click on it. You have to select which configuration you want. The $59.99 one is the old one, not the new one.

column2: Great quality in 3rd generation -- but NOT a TRUE red!
column5: This is an excellent product---3rd generation has even better sound quality than 2nd Gen. BUT, I was expecting RED, and the color is more an orange/coral, and NOT a true (fire engine) red; it has much more an dark orange appearance, with a white top (dirty fingerprints magnet) and a white plug and cord. I think this should be a true red if it's being sold as such, and should be also offered with a black top/cord/plug as an option. I gave mine to a friend, and he bought me a 3rd Gen in Charcoal, which is my preferred color. Had this been a TRUE RED, I would have hung onto it. If you like an orangey/coral color---go for it; just know that a "conceptual" design of red, and what actually ships are two different things. Also, I wish Amazon would add a speaker mute button; you can mute the microphone, but if your phone rings or something else requires you to want Alexa to stop making noise, you have to tell her to be quiet or pause; a speaker mute button would be nice. I suppose you could use the (-) volume control to turn her all the way down, but a quick and easy mute button would be faster and easier! Love this unit -- just not what they call "red."

column2: With more work a very good product
column5: First of all how about the names. You know I mean Amazon Echo and computer couldn't you be a little bit more inventive than that. This one was a gift. I have a total of 3 now. All in all they are all very good. My original Echo and this latest one have a very good sound to them. I believe the concept behind them is good, but they need refinement as sometimes I ask a question to which I receive a sensible answer another time I'll ask the same question and I'll get something like I don't know

Really brings you into the modern world and blows your mind away.  This is the first device I’ve ever known that actually feels like another person is in the room.  The ai is amazing and the voice response sounds so human and not robotic.  While the sound quality is much better than your typical speaker, it’s not studio quality.  It sure is loud though which is great.  You can naturally talk to it using phrases like “ok enough” when you want to stop an action.  You don’t have to talk to it like it’s a robot and worry about saying the “right commands”.  It understands you and just works.  I’ve bought 5 of them in the past week lol, and the studio is on its way tomorrow.  It also works flawlessly with the smart device in my home

I bought the Echo and Sub combination, and we really like the sound quality of this system. We're still training Alexa, but so far, she appears to be behaving well. The Sub Woofer adds a lot more sound, and makes the system fill the room with music. I put an Echo with the Sub, in our living room area, and I was so impressed with the sound quality, that I'm now going to add an Echo and Sub, to our dining room area, and the master bedroom.

I'm an Amazon/Alexa fan boy. I'll admit it and while these devices, I believe, generation after generation keep looking better and better, I don't see the feature set/sound getting significantly better than previous devices. Just my personal opinion, and I still have dots all thru the house, just don't see the need yet to pay the extra money for the full size version

The sound is great at all volumes, the drop in feature is great for our multi-level house (one up and one on the main). And she will notify you within 1-5 minutes after your package from them was delivered . Wish we could change her voice to someone like, James Earl Jones or Liz Taylor or ..... lol

I gotta say the sound quality is the best part. This is a must have as far as convenience. I have really bad internet too so and it took a bit to connect but now that it's connected I haven't had a single issue. Internet was my biggest fear with buying it but it's not a problem at all. This thing is loud asf too...which is awesome.I bought it for myself but I'm sure it'll make a great gift!In my video I was playing We Descend from Shadow Of Intent
I added this echo to my Alexa family. I love the sound quality and quick response time. I also use the echo Auto device which I love.
Convenient but frequently faulty. I have experienced this with all of my echoes, however this seems to be the worst.
